detailDescription.1:
About The Role

We'll cut to the chase and get to what makes this role exciting. Firstly, it’s a senior analyst role that is highly collaborative (think of it like a data consultant). Secondly, your work will directly impact the scope and growth of GoPay - Indonesia's largest e-wallet service. More specifically, you'll oversee GoPay's data products, which consist of automated data dashboards, reports, alerts, and simulation tools. Working closely with the Product and Business teams, you'll help address and resolve the platform's critical issues and guide the direction for its next features. In our opinion, the coolest part of this role is your ability to own the future of this product, ensure its quality and longevity, and see the results of your efforts in people's everyday lives.

What You Will Do
Conduct general analysis on each new feature/product that has been released/ will be released
Provide customer and merchant segmentation based on their personas
Conduct deep analytical dives into understanding customer behaviors to guide business decisions
Event performance analysis (i.e. cashback, promos, POI)
Provide visualizations to track GoPay performance
Data ETL (Extraction, Transform, and Load)
What You Will Need
At least 5 years of experience as an analyst, or in the Business Intelligence or Data Science fields
Advanced knowledge in all variants of SQL
Proficient in ETL (extract, transform, load)
Proficient in Metabase, Tableau, Bigquery, and Python
Excellent analytical, communication, and presentation skills to share recommendations clearly and effectively
Ability to work with team members on data science projects
Strong contribution in database design and data architecture, data mining and analytics, data security and privacy, and data visualization
Experience driving a project from inception to completion

About The Team

Our team likes to see ourselves as what blood is to the brain - constantly supplying the brain with oxygen so it can function properly. Our super team of 6 BI analysts supplies data and insights that fuel GoPay's innovations and evolutions. How does one achieve this, you may ask? Through our data products (automated dashboards, reports, alerts, and simulation tools) and continuous collaboration with the folks in the business and product teams. We are in charge of creating foundational customer segmentations, designing automation processes for campaign tracking, and providing regular reports to the leadership team. Anything data-related within growth, digital inclusion, or risk and fraud for GoPay is what our team is concerned about✌🏽

But despite how hardworking we may seem, we do know how to have fun, too. As a matter of fact, we select someone from the team to become our ‘Minister of Entertainment’ each month. The honorary person then will decide what fun activities we can do together😋. This is especially an important tradition for us with WFH becoming more normalized. While we do miss our monthly outings/dinners, thank goodness for the invention of Slack and Zoom calls that keep us feeling close.

About Us

Gojek is a Super App. It’s one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and dozen other products. It is Indonesia’s first and only decacorn. It's also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'

Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business and MSMEs.

As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion annualised gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia, (outside of China), and the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.

Our investors include Google, Facebook, PayPal, Sequoia Capital, Tencent Holdings among others.

Gojek is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

detailDescription.12:
OFFICE LOCATION

Jakarta, Indonesia

a Little About Us

Since 1951, The Nature Conservancy has been doing work you can believe in protecting the lands and waters that all life depends on. As a science-based organization, we create innovative, on-the-ground solutions to our world’s toughest challenges so that we can create a world in which people and nature thrive.

We’re rooted in our Mission and guided by our Values, which includes a Commitment to Diversity and Respect for People, Communities, and Cultures. We know we’ll only achieve our Mission by hiring and engaging a diverse workforce that reflects the communities in which we work. Whether it’s career development, work/life balance, or a rewarding mission, there’s lots of reasons to love life #insideTNC. Our goal is to cultivate an inclusive work environment so that all of our colleagues around the globe feel a sense of belonging, and that their unique contributions to our mission are valued.

YOUR POSITION WITH TNC

The NCS (Natural Climate Solution) Data Analyst will support science analysis and execution of the work plan for the Peatlands Natural Climate Solution under Bezos Fund Project and other production forestry activities in Indonesia.

Essential Functions
Designing and maintaining database including geospatial and tabular data systems for Peatlands Natural Climate Solution research project
Mining and reorganizing data from primary and secondary sources from publications or reports from consultants
Working knowledge on carbon dynamic and analysis
Providing quality assurance at various stages of the project in order to validate the analysis
Preparing appropriate documentation and reports based on relevant dataset
Providing substantial contributing for analysing and drafting scientific publication
Experience with data collection and conducting field work

Responsibilities And Scope
Geographic size and scope is that of a larger, complex business unit and/or a program that requires cross-boundary work and relationships
Frequently makes independently strategic decision based on analysis, ambiguous information and context.
Negotiates complex agreements, in a political environment.
May be responsible for leading or co-leading a whole system program.
Frequent travel domestically and/or internationally, evening and weekend hours.
May work in variable weather conditions, at remote locations, on difficult and hazardous terrain, and under physically demanding circumstances.
YKAN may, from time to time, assign the Employee to another location(s) in accordance with the requirements of the Employee’s job description and/or YKAN’s operational needs. The Employee agrees to work in such other work location(s) in Indonesia.

Minimum Qualifications
BA/BS degree and 5 years’ experience in geography, natural resources, computer science or related field
High level experience using database languages such as SQL, R, Python or JavaScript; spreadsheet tools such as Microsoft Excel or; and data visualization software
Has experience on GIS data analysis and demonstrated experience using geospatial software such as ArcMap, Google Earth Engine, eCognition, ERDAS, QGIS, or others
Has relevant experience on geospatial database development and management
Implementation experience in data governance, data quality & data modeling
Excellent presentation and interpersonal skills.
Communicating clearly via written, spoken, and graphical means in English.

Desired Qualifications
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in forestry, natural resources management, conservation or another related field of study and 5-10 years’ experience in forestry data management, climate change and GHG accounting. Equivalent combination of education and experience is preferred.
Has experience on peatlands GHG emissions accounting and record of scientific publication

AUTO SAFETY POLICY

This position requires a valid driver's license and compliance with the Conservancy's Auto Safety Program. Employees may not drive Conservancy-owned/leased vehicles, rental cars, or personal vehicles on behalf of the Conservancy if considered "high risk drivers." Please see further details in the Auto Safety Program document available at www.nature.org/careers .

Employment in this position will be contingent upon completion of a Vehicle Use Agreement, which may include a review of the prospective employee's motor vehicle record.

How To Apply

To apply to position number 49557, submit resume (required) and cover letter separately using the upload buttons. Applications will be reviewed in the order they’re received and the position will remain open until filled.

Click “submit” to apply for the position or “save for later” to create a draft application for future submission. Once submitted, applications cannot be revised or edited. Failure to complete required fields may result in your application being disqualified from consideration.

If you experience technical issues, please refer to our applicant user guide or contact applyhelp@tnc.org .

The Nature Conservancy is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Our commitment to diversity includes the recognition that our conservation mission is best advanced by the leadership and contributions of people of diverse backgrounds, beliefs and culture. Recruiting and mentoring staff to create an inclusive organization that reflects our global character is a priority and we encourage applicants from all cultures, races, colors, religions, sexes, national or regional origins, ages, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, military, protected veteran status or other status protected by law.

The successful applicant must meet the requirements of The Nature Conservancy’s background screening process.

detailDescription.22:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others.
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers.

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

detailDescription.26:
Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike.

Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind — to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.

Build fraud prevention products to secure payments across Southeast Asia.

Mission

The fraud team is building innovative fraud prevention products with the aim of securing online payments for businesses across Southeast Asia. By leveraging AI and machine learning on the vast amounts of transactional and identity data collected across the years, we are well positioned to help reduce the :USD 300 million(1.6% of revenue) in losses due to fraud experienced by Southeast Asia's businesses. This will help businesses focus on growth without fearing about losses due to fraud.

Data analysts in the fraud team are responsible for deriving insights from the multiple data sources that we have to inform product decisions with regards to feature engineering, model building etc. They are also responsible for building monitoring dashboards to detect potential fraud and therefore helping our merchants and Xendit to prevent losses due to fraud.

We are looking to expand the suite of features for our fraud detection product and are looking for passionate data analysts who have a deep interest in data, applied sciences or machine learning to join our team in building a scalable fraud prevention product for Southeast Asia. Join us if you would like to contribute to our cause in making the payment space safer and free of fraud and abuse.

Responsibilities
Build and maintain analytic dashboards
Identify common traits of fraud and build dashboards and alerting systems around these traits to detect and prevent fraud
Build dashboards to monitor product metrics such as chargeback rates, chargeback type breakdown etc.
Monitor merchants transactional behaviour and identify potential fraudulent activity that may result in losses for Xendit
Design, analyze, and interpret the results of experiments. Create hypotheses on potential fraud prevention methods and conduct exploratory data analysis to prove hypothesis - outcomes of analysis will guide the heuristics and features using in our risk scoring engine
Work with data scientists to build and improve our machine learning models
Create and maintain a system that enables clean labelling/flagging of fraudulent data which can be used to power our machine learning models.
Be the driver to explore new data sources that can improve our fraud detection system
Do whatever it takes to make Xendit succeed

You may be a good fit if
Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative or technical field
2+ years of hands-on experience as a data analyst/scientist
Experience with SQL, data analysis, visualization tools (e.g. Looker), or programming languages such as Python/R
Experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Experience delivering insights from data analysis to stakeholders
Experience doing data analysis in a big data environment (Spark, Presto, Hive)
Basic knowledge of using Python/R for data analysis and visualization
Great ownership mentality - taking initiative to improve our fraud prevention methods (finding new data sources, creating new data features etc.)
You thrive on autonomy and have proven you can push towards a goal by yourself
Pick up new skills quickly using a combination of reading and self-exploration
You communicate well across teams
Prior experience with payments, risk or fraud prevention/detection systems
Experience in building machine learning models


What We Care About
Solve for the customer first: You build what customers want. You think about what is right for customers, not what is easiest for you
Demonstrate mastery of honey badgery: You make ambitious goals. Then execute…no matter what stands in the way. When knocked down, you get up
Take on challenges willingly and can be trusted to execute: You can be trusted to get things done right the first time quickly. You hit your deadlines
You're like us: You smile a lot, think work is fun and don't take yourself too seriously. You measure yourself against the best and believe feedback is the breakfast of champions. You follow the golden rule.
You're remarkable: People naturally talk about how awesome you are. If we can't find someone who raves about you then it's unlikely we will too.
detailDescription.27:
About This Role

You will be one of the key people in our analytics team who supports business decisions through data and analysis across products in the SEA region.

Why This Role is Awesome
Key role and contributor: You will have the chance to be part of the core analytic team, involved in strategic analysis and team planning
Exposure: You will have the chance to work closely and communicate with teams across the company from C-levels and Management, Sales, Finance, Product, Marketing, and Operation
Growth: We are a fast-growing company that grew revenue six times in the past year while doubling headcount. You will be part of this growth trajectory and given lots of challenges to grow quickly
Impact: Our company's purpose is to contribute to a world where all people and organizations can realize their human potential (check our culture deck here: http://bit.ly/glintsculture)

What You’ll Be Doing
Business Analysis - Perform all-round business analysis to current performance to seek facts, insights, and give recommendations
Data Consultant - Support and enforce a data-driven mindset and insight to Glints TalentHub and Glints Academy businesses
Reports and Dashboards - Support business decisions by providing data with good visualization and powerful report
Sales and Ops Process Improvement - Analyse and understand the current sales and ops data collection and reporting process or system and suggest or recommend a proposed solution based on data or insight

What We Are Looking For

Must-Have
Minimum Bachelor Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Marketing analytics, Business analytics or in a related field
At least 1-3 years of experience in a fast-paced business/data analytics role or related
Good understanding and implementation of statistics and/or machine learning especially in predictive/analytics modeling techniques, theories, principles, and practices
Experienced using BI tools (e.g. Metabase and Tableau)
Proficient in SQL and Python/R
Have a highly analytical and structured approach in problem-solving
Strong logical, problem-solving, and critical thinking
Excellent communication, goal-oriented and good ability to work in a team, creative thinking, and collaborative
Proficient in English communications both verbal and written (business level)
Student for life mindset
Nice-to-Haves (yes, we really mean these are just nice to have!)
Knowledge in machine learning
Knowledge in programming languages
Knowledge in data infrastructure and engineering

Our Mission

At Glints, we are building the #1 full-stack tech-enabled career development and human resource ecosystem in Southeast Asia. Our product offerings span across early career discovery, continuous skills development, and tech-enabled local and cross-border recruitment.

Since we’ve started, we’ve had a clear mission: realizing human potential. We empower people to build their dreams by helping them hire the right people. Also, we help people join the right rocketship that will improve their lives. We have impacted many lives but there’s still plenty to do and we can’t do it alone. Learn more about us here.

Glints’ Growth Story by Numbers

We’ve used a tech-enabled approach to connect 1 million+ candidates to their next dream opportunities, supported 30,000+ companies in finding great talent, achieved double-digit enhancements in recruiter efficiency, and raised US$10M+ from best venture investors in Asia.

And speaking about growth, 2020 was a tough year to navigate, but quick adaptations and sticking to our core strategy allowed us to maintain growth. LinkedIn recognized us in the 2020 Top Startups List in Singapore - an annual ranking of the emerging startups to work for. Click here for the full article.

detailDescription.47:
About Firium

Firium Solutions (Asia Pacific) is one of the market leaders specialized in Financial Planning & Wealth Management solution with over a decade of experience and proven track record in the industry. We are driven by customer success in their digital transformation journey and experience from our industry domain and consulting expertise to deliver real business results.

We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Firium. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

The Role

We are now looking for an experienced and technically-skilled Senior / IT Business Analyst as an integral member of Firium’s Project Management & Service Delivery Group which is responsible for project management, businss analysis, solution & technical architecturing, application development and quality assurance for clients within the Banking, Financial Services and Insurance Industry.

This position is based in Jakarta, Indonesia.

Responsibilities
Solicit requirements gathering and facilitate requirements workshop with internal/external stakeholders
Elicits, analyzes, specifies, and validates the business needs of stakeholders
Identifies and establishes scope and parameters of requirements analysis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics
Works with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements
Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards
Translates conceptual customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team
Assists with the interpretation of customer requirements into feasible options, and communicating these back to the business stakeholders
Manages and tracks the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary
Liaising with technical specialists to understand the technical requirements
Clear documentation of requirements
Participates in the QA process to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized
Perform other Ad-hoc projects/tasks

Market Skills and Certifications

In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who can fulfill these criterias:

Bachelor in Computer Science / Information Technology, Computer Engineering or equivalent
A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis, preferably in the wealth management domain
At least 2 years of experience in Software Application Testing (nice to have)
Good understanding of QA processes and software testing methodologies
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Excellent documentation skills
Ability to multi-task and work under tight timeline and pressure
Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and spokenExperienced in SQL, MySQL and Oracle database systems

Specific Skill(s) Needed:

Fluent in English
Familiar with UML Flow diagrams

Specific Character(s) Preferred

Easy to communicate with (fluent in English)
Good problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Highly self-motivated and directed
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Strong customer service orientation
Attention to detail

Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours.

You will work under the guidance of the Finance Manager or Senior Analyst to maintain finance transactions, data, systems and reporting. You will also collect data and perform detailed checks/controls.

How You Will Contribute

You will:
Execute aspects of finance planning and performance management process and related financial decisions potentially including Annual Contract planning/forecasting, target development, financial performance reporting/analysis, financial modeling and decision support for a focused scope within a region, business unit, country, Supply Chain, Mondelēz International Business Services or Corporate Finance team. You will also execute data collection and prepare data integrity checks
Contribute to a strong controls and compliance environment in your area of scope and ensure full compliance with our policies
Execute ad hoc analyses and projects as requested by the Finance Manager or Senior Analyst
Support projects to improve efficiencies and improvements to ways of working and embrace a mindset of continuous improvement
Contribute to a high-performing Finance team. You will also invest in personal development and the development of your Finance peers


What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:
Minimum Bachelor Degree in Finance or Accounting
Technical Expertise in financial analysis and data collection/structuring
Business Acumen and relevant experience in a local or regional business
Leadership Skill including collaboration and communication skills within a Finance team. Team player with can do mentality to deliver results
Growth/Digital Mindset and the ability to execute opportunities and leverage technology to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness
Integrity and in all decisions and interactions aligned with our values and policies and external regulations

Within Country Relocation support available and for candidates voluntarily moving internationally some minimal support is offered through our Volunteer International Transfer Policy Business Unit Summary Mondelēz International in Southeast Asia is in five countries serving 19 markets with more than 18 nationalities and 7,500 employees. This group is emerging as one of the fastest growing regions in Asia, the Middle East and Africa, and we are proud of consistently producing high quality products in nine manufacturing sites. We are market leaders in key snacking categories, making and selling brands like Oreo and Tiger biscuits, Kinh Do mooncakes, Jacob’s crackers, Cadbury Dairy Milk chocolate, Tang powdered beverage, Halls candy and Eden cheese. We set the benchmark in being a responsible business and contributing to the communities in which we operate.
Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

detailDescription.61:
Senior Analytics Specialist. Jakarta, Indonesia

We are looking for a Senior Analytics Specialist in our great office in Jakarta, Indonesia. The role will play a pivotal role in working directly with key functions and mining our extensive database to discover important insights and recommending key partners on key strategic business decisions.

As a part of OLX Group, we’re a team of 5,000 ambitious, curious people building marketplace platforms that make it super easy for anyone to buy and sell almost anything, boosting local economies.

What you will be doing:

Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques and provide reports, insights, strategies, recommendations, and dashboards relevant to the key partners
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in various complex data sets
Work closely with key senior partners in ensuring that the business decisions are data-driven, customer-centric and prioritize information needs
Build automated reports and dashboards based on partner requirements to support the decision-making process
Configure and develop both, ad hoc and scheduled reports using Python, SQL, Tableau, and/or Google Sheets

Who we’re looking for:

Minimum 3 years related experience as data scientist/analyst (or another field related to data processing) with exposure to digital marketing or product analytics
Hardworking to continuously learn especially in the data science field
Structured and logical, data-driven, can-do demeanor, fun, and open person
Speaks three languages: English, Bahasa Indonesia, and SQL
Advanced skill in Microsoft Excel; having knowledge of Python, R, or Tableau would be a big advantage
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques such as Decision Trees, Clustering, Regression, etc. would be an advantage
Good communication and social skills
Problem solver and able to work under minimum supervision
Thrives in a constantly evolving environment and introduces fresh opinions
Has the curiosity to dig deep into data to get to the root of, and seek business problems

What we’ll give you:

Dynamic, smart, and funny colleagues who love to work with great people like you and achieve success together
Exposure to global opportunities; collaboration with the global team and/or global training.
Competitive compensation and benefits
Opportunity to make a difference and to help improve people’s lives by bringing them together for win-win exchanges

What you need to know about us:

OLX is part of the OLX Group, the world’s #1 classifieds business. 20 brands, 5 continents, and over 350m monthly active users. Our mission is to shape the future of trade to unlock the hidden values of everything
Frontier Car Group (FCG) builds and runs marketplaces focused on emerging markets in the auto sector. FCG vision is to increase the efficiency of selling and buying cars through technology, infrastructure creation, access to capital, and innovative business models
FCG brings the expertise in the transactional part & together with OLX creates the opportunity for an end to end solution
OLX acquired FCG late 2019 and has now been folded into the OLX Autos vision
OLX Autos group consists of a combined business across multiple geographies. All of the FCG instant cash business and all of the OLX emerging markets businesses across India, Indonesia, LATAM, US, Africa some parts in Poland came together to solve customer problems better and build an exciting business.
Our vision is to build an end to end ecosystem for the automotive industry. Be the one-stop-shop for buying and selling cars. We want to become the most trusted partner for car buyers and sellers and offer them peace of mind on every transaction they make with us
We are proud to be different, and we work differently too. We combine the spirit and agility of a start-up with the maturity that comes from being part of a 100-year-old company.
We are curious, ambitious, and allergic to corporate interference. We improvise, experiment, and push each other further, embracing uncertainty and driving change

If you are as excited as us about this position and our company, we hope you join us! If you’d like to learn more about the OLX Group take a look at the other parts of our website. And remember, we are an equal opportunities employer.

Are you a data rock star? Do you enjoy developing a framework for scale able reporting and supporting sales? Are you looking for a challenge that allows you to use and enhance your analytical skills?

detailDescription.71:
Aspire is the #1 business neobank for modern businesses. With a mission to reinvent digital banking for SMEs, entrepreneurs, and a new generation of digital-savvy businesses, we are building a platform that offers what financial products our customers need, how they need it.

Founded in 2018 by former Lazada founders and executives, Aspire has successfully raised USD 40M from world-class investors and financial partners such as Y-combinator and others. It has partnered with leading financial firms like Visa and Transferwise to power its solutions. In 2020, we were awarded as the #1 Hottest Startup by Singapore Business Review and Startup [Fintech] Award by TechNode Global ORIGIN Awards. Currently, we have ~100 employees from offices in Singapore, Thailand, Indonesia and Vietnam.

You will be amazed and energized by the diverse backgrounds of our people. We are a team made up of ex-entrepreneurs, ex-founders and high-achievers who want to make an impact yet always collaborate and don’t take NO for an answer. We have high bars during our assessment process because we want to inspire and to be inspired by other teammates.

We are still expanding and hiring more top talent who are passionate about startups to join the journey of building a neobank to support the under-serviced SMEs and entrepreneurs.

The Role

What will you be doing?

Review of credit applications, research business models and design the best way to evaluate credit risk of SME
Assessing and analyzing borrower's financial and other data points to help to assist in credit decisions.
Participate in working with the team to develop, improve and monitor our proprietary credit model, a core component of our business.
Perform other ad-hoc based tasks related to credit risk function
Ideal Profile

What will you need?

Bachelor’s degree in finance, banking, or related fields with outstanding academic records
Minimum 1 year working experience as credit analyst or related roles, preferably in bank
Possess hunger and ability to become Senior Credit Risk Analyst within short period of time
Analytical, with strong communication skills, and the ability to operate with flexibility in a fast-paced, constantly evolving and collaborative environment
Good understanding on SMEs would be added advantage
Passionate for the fintech industry and is a start-up culture fit
Fluent in English
What's on Offer?

Opportunity to make a positive impact
Exposure to a team of international and talented colleagues in the region
Fantastic work culture
detailDescription.72:
About Cobblestone

Cobblestone Energy is an independent trading firm. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading. Although we have experienced very strong growth so far, we are still near the start of our journey. We have ambitions to go a lot further.

Energy in one form or another is fundamental to almost all the world's economic activities. By understanding the demand, supply, and logistics of these commodities, we can better understand the world.

We specialize in the proprietary trading of the short-term wholesale electricity markets across Europe. We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country and growing every day. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.

Over the years we have grown organically. As part of our journey to be the best in all markets we enter, we would like to welcome a Talent Analyst into our HR (Human Resources) team. For this role we are looking for someone who has a passion for numbers and ability to use data to make decisions. HR experience is not mandatory however an interest in HR is important.

Cobblestone Values
Lifelong learning with continuous reflection
Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas
The team is more important than the individual.
Being the best in any market we enter
Hiring and keeping only the most effective people


HR Talent Analyst - Dubai, UAE

Starting Remuneration of 35,000 USD per annum, 0% Tax environment.

Are you passionate about finding and placing top talent and you know how to reach and engage candidates on a human level?

As a talent analyst, you will be responsible for executing our strategy for talent acquisition and continuously enhancing our selection process using data and candidate insights. Hiring is a key aspect of our operations and people play the greatest role in our advancement and success. We are looking for an ambitious and highly efficient resources that can deliver results. A professional that can match our hiring process with the best candidates across the world to ensure that we have the most talented individuals for our team.

What We Offer In This Role
A full-time position on our HR team
Opportunity to work closely with the management team.
Committed and remarkably talented colleagues.
Great compensation and rewards
An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career.
An opportunity to work on new things from scratch and make independent decisions.
Ability to work remotely.


Responsibilities
Determine and meet the company's current staffing needs.
Support in developing talent acquisition strategies and hiring plans.
Provide sound analysis and advice to business heads on the selection process.
Manage all candidate communication.
Prepare hiring dashboards.
Conduct in depth analysis on the selection process and use the insights to make improvements to the process.
Identify and partner with recruitment agencies and job sites.
Build strategic tie ups with reputed colleges for campus placement.
Manage job postings on social media.
Meet agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for hiring.
Lead employment branding initiatives.
Perform sourcing to fill open positions and anticipate future needs.
Plan and ensure recruitment and selection processes (interviews, screening calls etc.) are conducted on time.
Take steps to ensure a positive candidate experience.
Organize and/or attend career fairs, assessment centres or other events.
Manage other HR activities as required.


Requirements
Strong numerical and research skills.
Passion for data analysis.
Proficient in the use of social media and job boards.
Willingness to understand the duties and competencies of different roles.
Excellent communicator.
Strong EQ skills.
Good Organization and reporting skills.
A passion for building talented teams.
Resilience and a determination to succeed.
Independent thinkers with growth mindset.
Must be passionate, self-motivated, and able to learn quickly.
Strong sense of integrity.
Personal values that match our company values.


Desirable Qualities
1-2 years of experience in recruiting and talent acquisition.
Experience in full cycle recruiting and sourcing.
A passion for developing employer branding.
Proficient in the use of social media.
Experience in data processing, excel, SQL, databases.
Working knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and databases


Job Location:

The role will be based in our Corporate office in Dubai.

Office Location:

Jumeirah Business Centre 2, Cluster V, Jumeirah Lake Towers, Dubai, United Arab Emirates

detailDescription.74:
Data Management and Analysis Specialist,

Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (MEL) Platform for USAID/Indonesia,

Jakarta, Indonesia

Project Summary

Management Systems International (MSI) is sub to Panagora Group in its implementation of the Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (MEL) Platform for USAID/Indonesia. The Indonesia MEL Platform team will deliver technical, consulting, and advisory services related to monitoring, evaluation and learning and other relevant short, medium, and long-term technical expertise to USAID/Indonesia. MSI will be an integral part of the Panagora team assembled to support the implementation of the USAID/Indonesia Country Development Cooperation Strategy (CDCS) for FY 2021 - FY 2025, its projects and activities. This position is based in Jakarta, Indonesia.

Please note: Only Indonesian citizens are eligible for this position**

Position Summary

Data Management and Analysis Specialist is responsible for the design, implementation, management of data collection, analysis, and support of evaluation in accordance with the standards of USAID’s Evaluation Policy.

Responsibilities
Design, implement, and/or manage data collection and analysis in accordance with the standards of USAID’s Evaluation Policy.
Assistance in formulating evaluation questions, determining methodologies for sampling, data collection, and data analysis
Assistance with developing data collection instruments, undertaking data collection, recoding, analyzing, reporting and disseminating findings and recommendations and distilling lessons learned
Conduct implementation research
Conduct secondary analyses of data from relevant surveys and studies using software such as Excel, NVivo, or STAT
Support the development of data visualization using software such as Tableau, GIS, or Adobe InDesign
Supporting use of evaluation results for adaptive management of activities
Prepare data sets and data assets for submission to the USAID Data Development Library (DDL) such as cleaning data sets, anonymizing data, ensuring data collection code books are accurate and complete
Other duties assigned by the Senior Monitoring Advisor


Qualifications
Master’s degree in statistics, research methods, social science, international development, monitoring and evaluation, public health, social sciences or a related field required
Minimum of ten years’ experience in the data collection and analysis in an international development context
Experience developing data collection instruments
Experience managing qualitative and quantitative data collection and analysis
Experience developing sampling plans and conducting statistical analysis
Strong reporting and writing skills
Fluency in written and spoken English and Indonesian required

Only candidates who have been selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls, please.

MSI is an EEO/AA/ADA Veterans Employer.

Reasonable Accommodations: MSI is dedicated to hiring an inclusive workforce. If you would like to request reasonable accommodations during the application process, please email MSI.Dept.HRRecruiting@tetratechinc.onmicrosoft.com with “Reasonable Accommodations” in the title. Our recruitment team looks forward to engaging in an interactive process to provide reasonable accommodations for candidates.

detailDescription.76:
Payments – Data Analyst

Job Description

Traveloka is a Southeast Asian internet unicorn focused on travel and mobility. Currently we are rapidly expanding in the region and globally. To achieve this, we need to ensure that we have a world class payment system that is seamless for our customers.

As a Data Analyst (DA) in the payments group, you will need to understand the entire payment flow, from booking to checkout across different methods & geographies. You will be required to provide timely analytics, as well as product recommendations to shape the future of Traveloka's payment systems. DAs are critical roles within our business and you know that you can make the greatest impact by gaining in-depth and comprehensive business domain knowledge.

In turn, we'll provide you with a mature analytics environment to work in. Reproducibility and full version control is a default in our systems so that you can easily learn from your teammates and build on foundations that have already been developed. Our collaborative team will ensure that you're more productive than you've ever been in a few short months.

Our tech stack: BigQuery, dbt, Python, Github, Google Data Studio, Plotly Dash, Airflow, Google Cloud Build

Main Responsibilities
Understand our payment flow, which includes the various payment methods such as bank transfer, credit cards, instalments.
Develop dashboards not just for monitoring, but to produce actionable insights that decision makers can use to steer the business.
Work with other product and/or data teams to provide data context for cross-functional initiatives.
Work with the business to answer tactical questions, often via our experiments platform, that will affect the development of product features.
Develop ETL pipelines within a robust framework that is highly automated and does not require a large team to maintain and monitor
Enable our key stakeholders to improve their understanding and analytical power


Qualifications
0 to 3 Years working experience (Fresh graduates welcome!) with at least a Bachelor degree in a quantitative field.
You have to be curious and hungry to learn, take ownership of your own journey, having bias for action and impact oriented.
Strong foundations in data manipulation and inferential statistics with Python and SQL.
Being meticulous towards details, having empathy for your stakeholders and peers.
Strong in communications to both non-technical and technical audiences.
Comfortable working with open-ended questions and potentially ambiguous problem statements.

JOB PURPOSE

CHC Business Analyst is responsible for managing activities related to Marketing Support (Market Research, Customer Insights, Business analytics, Data management), Sales Performance Support (Sales Force Automation and Incentive Compensation) and managing a team of 2 persons responsible for Data Management & Analytics and Sales Force Automation & Incentive Compensation.

Key Result Areas/Responsibilities

Market Research, Customer Insights

1.1. Assess and scope market research projects in line with business priorities & BU strategic imperatives, recommend the appropriate research to fit the needs of the business

1.2. Closely collaborate with Procurement to source and contract with relevant Market Research agencies, monitor their effectiveness and ensure market research activities are carried out in accordance with official guidelines such as respecting the global vendor strategy and guidelines regarding study design etc…

1.3. Collect and analyze Customer insights, conduct Customer segmentation in coordination with Franchise recommendation (where appropriate)

1.4. Develop & maintain framework and guides to collect primary market research (best practices)

1.5. Collect & analyze Pharma market trends & competitive intelligence

1.6. Responsible for Market Data subscribed by Sanofi; i.e.: IPMG, IQVIA, Sanisphere, etc.

1.7. Point of contact for Regional/Global BI tools management and data collection, such as, but not limited to: ASSIST, Flashcard, IPMG, IQVIA, Sanisphere

Business Analytics

2.1. Prepare robust analyses of market trends in the country, sales results and competitive position (e.g. market share)

2.2. Analyze performance based on system reports

2.3. Enhance primary & secondary data as decision-making insights for the BU

2.4. Work with Finance and GBU GMs to coordinate activities for the creation of the 3YFF & LRP (incl. market plan & data analysis activities for all products, sales & OPEX forecasts

2.5. Utilize advanced analytics to improve performance and support resource allocation

Data Management

3.1. Ensure role as Data integrity officer for Sanofi ID

3.2. Leverage in the country the cross and/or GBU-specific systems in collaboration with ITS team and advocate for the specific needs of the country with the BI / Data global governance

3.3. Oversee the generation of data for input into existing cross and/or GBU-specific systems

3.4. Manage secondary global (e.g. IMS data) and local data vendors in coordination with Global BI guidelines for global vendors

Sales Performance Support

4.1. Implement the SFA strategies within the Country while optimizing the cross GBU efficiencies at country level:

4.1.1. Advocate for local needs in the development of the global core models or for the customization of the core model at country level

4.1.2. Manage and leverage the customer relationship management systems for field force effectiveness analyses, performance dashboards and tools

4.2. Drive the development of sales force incentive plans in line with Global Policy and GBUs/Brand objectives

4.2.1. Incentive & sales reward scheme

4.2.2. Incentive payout analysis

Experience, Qualifications And Competencies Required

Length and width of previous experience:

1.1. A 10-year or longer experience in a sales and marketing role in the healthcare or relevant industry

1.2. Substantial market research / business analytics / CRM/SFA experience, market data knowledge and analytical ability

Professional qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, or scientific discipline
Excellent Language proficiency in English both written and spoken
Functional/technical competencies

4.1. Strong marketing, market research, business analytical, and planning skills

4.2. Detailed understanding of relevant country code of practice and its practical application in a business environment

Behavioral competencies (key soft skills)

5.1. Leadership of multidisciplinary teams to effective implementation of strategy

5.2. Clear communication style that will inspire and direct teams

5.3. Autonomy, Result-driven, customer focus

5.4. Drive for efficiency - use of lean processes, drive automation, outsourcing

Leadership competencies

6.1. Ability to communicate with influence to achieve results

6.2. People development

At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

detailDescription.83:
Position Snapshot

Location: Karawang, West Java, Indonesia

Company: PT Nestlé Indonesia

Full Time On-site Employment

Position Summary

Joining Nestlé means you are joining the largest food and Beverage Company in the world. At our very core, we are a human environment – passionate people driven by the purpose of unlocking the power of food to enhance quality of life for everyone, today and for generations to come.

Be a force for good with Nestlé Indonesia by playing the role as a Factory Costing Specialist, you will be responsible to be key facilitator to the Annual Cost Budget process with close coordination to some relevant department in providing dynamic forecast to Business Units, Corporate Costing and Business Planning & Reporting. Having strong analytical to ensure accurate, timely, efficient and correct data input for manufacturing costing and reviewing the production cost.

A day in the life of...
Review and analyze factory variances and provide transparency on variances to management
Review and analyze actual costs of production
Provide the insight on how Costs of Production translate to COGS on the profit and loss statement
Drive and own the strategic planning process for Costs of Production and COGS
Deliver and develop process and solutions to forecast report
Analyze and validate material price assumptions from Procurement; provide insight to Factory Leadership Team on financial impact of price movements
Review and analyze factory key performance indicators including operations performance, financial performance and compliance measures
Provide benchmarking and cost analysis requests and support the business on SKU optimization reviews.
Involve on Period End Close (PEC) process; Master Data & factory health checks.
Ensure timely communication of targeted information to the relevant parties; ensure services provided are in line with agreed expectations
Deliver and provide costing knowledge to Business Units and Factory Leadership Team

What Will Make You Successful
Have minimum bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance or Accounting
Having at least 3-5 years’ experience as Costing Analyst
Having several experiences in Business Excellent, Decision Support, Supply Chain and Audit would be an advantage
Good Communication Skills
Strong understanding about Accounting Standard, Manufacturing Costing and other reporting guidelines
Solid Knowledge of business principles and best practices to ensure sustainability of business and drive continuous performance improvement
Proficiency in SAP and Microsoft Excel

We are Nestlé, the largest food and beverage company. We are 308,000 employees strong driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Our values are rooted in respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for our future. With more than CHF 91.4 billion sales in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic inclusive international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions and geographies, working with diverse teams and cultures. Want to learn more? Visit us at www.nestle.com
detailDescription.84:
Job Description:

Get to know the role:

As the thought partner of West Java GrabFood leadership, you will influence the overall strategic direction of GrabFood. Your analyses will be backed by a deep understanding of our business model and data insights, with the ultimate goal of driving growth or profitability for the business. This role will be based in Bandung, and you will be reporting & working closely with the Demand Strategy & Planning team of GrabFood.

The Day to Day:

Critically evaluate and define business metrics; provide analytical recommendations to support the continuous improvement of West Java GrabFood business
Consolidate data from multiple sources including finance, operations, marketing and source databases to create integrated and scalable views that can be used to drive decision making
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs/ pain points to scope up their problems and enhance internal processes through automation to improve productivity
Communicate strategic recommendations based on insights to our business leaders in clear and illustrative presentations and dashboards
The must-haves:

3-5 years of experience in business analyst related roles analyzing large data sets and informing company strategy
Proficiency in SQL, Tableau Excel and PowerPoint, Knowledge in Python or R is a plus
Experience in groceries or e-commerce in a fast-paced and performance-driven environment is a plus
Problem solver: When dealing with complex business problems, you are ready to solve them. You are able to assess the problem, find a creative and effective solution, and employ the tactics and tools to resolve the situation in a timely manner
Growth mindset: You are hungry to learn. In the start-up world, things are expected to change and move quickly, you are not only able to keep up with new trends but also possess the skill sets to apply the lessons learned.
Effective communicator: concise and articulate in any medium, you are able to convert a large amount of information and data into clear message
Scalable solutioning: you are able to think and plan ahead, building out scalable information systems/dashboards for the GrabFood team to utilise for day-to-day business decisions.
Willing to work under Contract

detailDescription.87:
Overview

We support applications that cover entire supply chain business processes from planning to product delivery at the customer stores. Solutions and applications used for the ERP, warehouse, and freight management are one of the integral parts of our business value chain.

This position has responsibility to lead operation technology Indonesia for supporting day to day business operations and the projects in the area of ERP management, new customer business solutions and warehouse infrastructure. Successful implementation will require a coordinated team effort with members across business and technology. Additionally, the position will also lead in supporting solutions during stable business operation.

This Position Is Rewarding For a Person Who Can
Work in a changing environment and easily adapt to the changing situations
Work closely & collaboratively with users (internal team, Suppliers, Customers)
Utilize his communication skills in English and Mandarin
And able to enjoy working across regions

Responsibilities
Working with the Senior Manager Technology Cluster, external service providers and Technology leaders, support the management and development of Technology Service strategies (global, region, country). Managing, assuring, and supporting the following : Technology Project, Supply Chain, Demand Management, Financial Management, Strategy, Service Portfolio Management
Working with the Senior Manager Regional Technology Services, external service providers and Technology leaders, ensure that Technology Services are understood, designed, and fit for purpose (global, region, country). Managing, assuring, and supporting the following : The Service Catalogue, Service Level Management, Capacity Management, Security, Supplier Management (local suppliers)
Collaborating with the Senior Manager Regional Technology Services, external service providers and Technology leaders, ensure and assure that Area Technology services are planned, documented, and implemented in accordance with customer requirements and our Technology processes and policies. Managing, assuring, and supporting the following : Knowledge Management, Asset & Configuration Management, Release & Deployment, Transition Planning & Testing
Assisting with the Senior Manager Technology Cluster, external service providers and Technology leaders, ensure and assure that all Technology services are operated in accordance with customer requirements and our Technology processes and policies. Managing, and supporting: Incident Management, Problem Management, Event Management & Resolution
Support the development and implementation of new boarding customer
Take delegated responsibility for infrastructure project delivery in the Markets in scope, ensuring and assuring that projects are delivered to scope, on time, on budget and all changes are tested, fit for purpose, and approved for implementation to the live environment
Support Digital Workplace development initiatives driven by the Digital Workplace Champion.
Coordinate the implementation of global standards relating to physical and environmental aspects of all data centers, server rooms/racks etc.
Liaise with vendors/suppliers to ensure our standards relating to all EUDs and software (include PCs, Printers, other devices) are met

Desired Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s degree level in computer sciences, Information technology or other relevant discipline
Language skills: English (Read/Write/Spoken), Mandarin or Bahasa is a plus
5-7 years of experience working directly with customers/business functions for implementing & supporting business applications/solutions
Experience of Defining business requirement with End-users
Experience in programing (.NET Java, SQL) is preferred.
Experience in industries of Logistics/Warehouse should be an advantage
Take initiative and prioritize work accordingly
Achieve own goals and support others to create an environment of success
Has a growth orientation; seeks continuous improvement
Proactively comes up with creative ideas and supports the implementation
Cooperates and relates well with others within and between organizations
Proactively communicates at all levels, internal and external

detailDescription.88:
Job Description

The Head of Data Analyst leads the data analytics team and oversees the activities of the junior personnel. In this role, he/she ensures that the business in its various divisions understands its own health, finds growth levers, and identifies opportunities for optimization. He/she leads the business through all efforts that drive business performance and potential by using the existent and new data sources and techniques.

The Head of Data Analyst additionally leads the data analytics team in the development of a departmental culture, policies, and strategy. The role will involve he/she getting his hands dirty and solving hard analytical problems for the business, reporting directly to the Head of Product Management.

Responsibility

Responsibilities
Leadership/supervisory/support role: this role is first and foremost a leader within the department overseeing all activities of the data analytics.
Strategy: play a leading strategic role where he leads the data analytics and data warehousing departments in strategy development with regard to the collection, manipulation, and analysis of data for various business functions/departments such as marketing, sales, operations, among others. He/she also endeavors to create new data-driven approaches for the purpose of generating business insights through data analytics, information visualization, and addressing unanswered business issues in a proactive manner.
Analytics: play an analytical role where he/she develops and applies analytical algorithms and methods where possible with a view of driving and enhancing data systems and streamlining business processes. In this capacity, he/she strives to improve the quality of analytics solutions on a consistent basis. It is also the duty of the Head of Analytics to validate, interpret, and create reports and presentations for departmental heads/management, and relevant stakeholders.
Collaboration: this role is a highly collaborative role and, as such, facilitates joint brainstorming and team collaboration. The Head of Data Analytics works closely with Product Management department in establishing departmental goals and strategies. He additionally works with junior data analytics and data warehouse personnel in defining the data collection needs of the business for the purpose of future work and also for guaranteeing that there is high data-quality and reliability across the business. The Head of Data Analytics further collaborates with numerous departments across the business, aiding them in the proper use of data, hence, ensuring the delivery of desired operational results.


Requirement

Administrative Requirements
Must not currently active in school or college
Able to work full-time at Agate HQ (Bandung, Indonesia)


Requirements
Have a background in data science, computer science, information technology, economics, information systems, statistic, applied math, business administration or any other related field. An equivalent of this requirement in working experience is also acceptable.
Must have at least 2-3 years of working experience as a data analyst, preferably working as a senior data analyst in a fast-paced business setting.
Excellent communication skills in both writing and verbal form. Able to communicate between different departments and divisions within the company, as well as creating engaging reports and presentations to stakeholders.
Computer skills: excellent in word/presentation processing tools, SQL, Tableau, or any other data visualisation tools.
Must demonstrate a passion for research and data, and be highly skilled in performing quantitative analyses on various business functions.
Must be proficient in the workings of data technologies.
Self-motivated, proactive, helpful, and service-oriented.
Have an ability to make strong, lasting, and meaningful connection with others. (People skill)
detailDescription.89:
JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT
The Trade Compliance Operations Analyst II will perform a range of moderate-to-complex activities using comprehensive trade compliance operations knowledge. Using independent, critical problem-solving skills, you'll collaborate with internal and external business partners to drive continuous improvement.

Key Accountabilities
Coordinate and process the execution of global trade compliance operations activities, and pre/post transactional audits and trade data to ensure data integrity, adherence to processes, control effectiveness and compliant performance.
Manage and ensure Customs Clearance process / activities as per SLA, KPI designed.
Ensures pre-transaction regulatory requirements are fulfilled, using a substantial knowledge and understanding of global trade compliance operations practices and procedures.
Applies substantial understanding of global trade compliance operations practices and procedures to ensure compliant execution of cross border transactions
Ensures that global trade operations procedures are supported by proper due diligence demonstrating reasonable care.
Utilizing a thorough understanding of trade compliance laws, regulations, practices and procedures, and work with country Manager / Area Lead and Compliance excellence team to resolve issues.
Apply and maintain trade compliance operations strategy, implement and maintain trade compliance standards and best practice processes to operationalize corporate policies and risk control frameworks to comply with Government laws and regulations including those administered by the participating government agencies.
Implements and monitor on day today activity global trade operations and compliance processes, “SOP”, and other compliance-related activities.
Collaborates with the different teams and functions to facilitate the execution the businesses global trade activities, focusing on compliance with both the foreign trade regulations and operational efficiencies
Develop a relationship with local governmental agencies in the respective country, in cooperation with appropriate functional areas and our brokers, facilitating a free flow of our goods through the borders, including the use of Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and regular internal report.
To monitor Customs Broker Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and compliance through regular interaction and running customs broker evaluation program as per designed.
Monitor and provide quarterly, bi-weekly and/or monthly metrics and reports.
Support Continuous Improvement initiatives
Other duties as assigned
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Minimum 5 years’ experience in the areas of customs, import/export
Demonstrated ability to excel in ambiguous situations
Proficient in Microsoft Office with expertise in Microsoft Excel
Fluent English and local language in both written and verbal.
Highly collaborative – ability to excel in a team environment
Self-starter – highly motivated with demonstrated initiative
Preferred Qualifications
5 Years’ experience in the areas of customs, import/export, operations
Certified as Customs Declarant / Customs Broker License
Experience with SAP and GTS (Global Trade Services) module
Experience executing and ensuring trade compliance operations of Free Trade Agreement (FTA), Duty Draw Back and Free Trade Zone operations is a plus
KEY BEHAVIORS
Gain the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity and authenticity.
Make sense of complex, high-quantity, and sometimes contradictory, information to effectively solve problems and manage ambiguity.
Use the most effective and efficient processes to accomplish work, focusing on continuous improvement.
Plan and prioritize work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals.

detailDescription.91:
About The Role

As our Business Intelligence Analyst for the Merchant Platform, you’ll collaborate with other cross-functional teams (Product Managers, Business Strategist, Marketing, Research, and Data Science) to find useful business insights within a large amount of data. You’ll assist these teams in setting up success metrics for particular products/features, optimize existing services and systems, and ensure data quality and source of truth availability.

On a daily basis, you’ll process data streams to produce data foundation, analytical dashboards, and product / feature trackers. Here, you'll get a front row seat in understanding how one of the largest Asian SuperApps makes use of its data. Your efforts will help remove highly-complex analytical blockers presented to the team, and contribute to the overall expansion and efficiency of Gojek's Merchant platform.

What You Will Do
Act as a thought partner/collaborate with cross functional stakeholders in helping the team set the success metrics for particular products/features, optimize existing services and systems, and ensure data quality and source of truth availability
Drive data-driven decision making and practices within the cross-functional team through strong project management practices
Independently execute root cause analysis to solve the issues impacting product or feature roll-out to serve our merchants-partners better
Continuously improve and govern the foundational data context that supports the end-to-end product through enforcing strong data management practices and challenging the system development and business process which negatively impacts the trust to our data context; develop or establish the policy to govern internal stakeholders when required
Develop required self-serving analytics tools (i.e. data mart, dashboard, tracker) with proper data modelling to democratize data for our stakeholders; establish required data acquisition and pipeline to build the self-serving analytics tools by driving product and data warehouse counterparts
Evaluate product experiments and measure the impact to our North Star metric (e.g. proactively suggest A/B tests or experimentations for product features and evaluate the impact on whether to increase the exposure or to stop the experiment)
What You Will Need
At least 4 years of experience in Business Intelligence / Product Analytics / System or Business Analyst (within these industries is a plus: B2B, tech consultancy, or in a hyper-growth tech company)
Experience in master data management and data migration best-practices are a must
Excellent problem-solving and process thinking skills
Well-versed with SQL (primarily analytics function) and Python for analysis in cloud environments (Google Bigquery)
Good understanding and experience in data modelling, ETL, data visualization and reporting tools (eg. Tableau / Metabase / Google Data Studio)
Comfortable using statistical/mathematical approaches to solve analytical problems
Experience with Clevertap / Google Analytics is a big plus

About The Team

The Merchant Platform team is a big group of over 50 team members based across Singapore and Indonesia. The gist of our role is to create an ecosystem of solutions to support our merchant-partners on the Gojek platform better manage and grow their business, while enabling both internal and external product stakeholders to develop merchant-based solutions in a sustainable manner.

Our merchant-partners are one of the core stakeholders in our Gojek ecosystem; they’re involved in various offerings such as food delivery, offline payment acceptance, POS, financial services, deals, and promotions. As the Merchant Platform team, we work closely with our merchant-partners to understand their daily needs and concerns, and relay these insights to our internal product stakeholders to build platforms and interfaces on our mobile apps that ensure our merchant-partners’ success on the Gojek platform. Should you have a question about how to run processes in the development of merchant-partner products, we are your people! Currently, our team has been specifically hard at work tackling issues within the engineering arena to enhance the experience our merchant-partners have utilizing our platform and services. We aim to establish Gojek as the most trusted partner for all our merchant-partners.

We’re a tight-knit, high-functioning team who genuinely love what we do, as we can see the results of our efforts play out in our merchant-partners’ everyday lives. When we aren’t working, you’d probably find us with our nose in books, or our eyes glued to the TV screen watching the latest Netflix drama. We’re equally concerned with each others’ personal and professional developments, and work together to get our job done well.

About Us

Gojek is a Super App. It’s one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and dozen other products. It is Indonesia’s first and only decacorn. It's also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'

Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business and MSMEs.

As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion annualised gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia, (outside of China), and the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.

Our investors include Google, Facebook, PayPal, Sequoia Capital, Tencent Holdings among others.

Gojek is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

detailDescription.93:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Supply Optimization and Commercialization (SOCs) team sits within the Product Supply team at Agoda Bangkok. We work closely with the sales department (Partner Services) to identify and optimize growth opportunities on accommodations supply for the company and to set up experiments to measure and implement changes. The projects SOCs team works on directly impact Agoda’s bottom line and have long lasting structural impact to the business. We cover a range of topics including organizational efficiency, sales and product optimization, go to market strategies as well innovation and products. We collaborate with multiple departments and produce highly visible results backed up by experimentation and data. Utilizing powerful tools and possessing an end-to-end view of how Agoda works, the SOCs offers a team of learning and experience that will push you (and Agoda) into new territory.

The Opportunity:

The SOCs Analytics team is a sub-team within the SOCs team and serve as subject matter experts on analytics, automation, business intelligence, data, and experimentation. We work closely with the other business, product, and analytics teams to develop and build analytical products, systems and automated processes, as well as drive analytical projects to improve organisational performance and drive revenue growth for the company. The analyst will assist in managing the operations of complex analytical processes, algorithms and automated systems being used across the Supply side of the organisation. The ideal candidate will have a blend of operational and analytical skillsets.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

Manage complex analytics processes and algorithms to ensure their continued smooth operation, identifying root causes and debugging them where needed
Use and analyse data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and understand data flows across the entire organisation
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at improving the operations of our automated systems (e.g. root cause detection, anomaly detection, performance analysis)
Develop automated infrastructure supporting business intelligence at a global level as well as the analytics processes supporting them
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organisational efficiency


What you’ll Need to Succeed:

A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping.
Either Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline with extensive programming experience
Experience in big data cleaning and wrangling as well as simple analytical processing (SQL is a must)
A basic understanding of statistics and data, and the ability to implement this understanding in complex business situations
The ability to visualise and understand complex data flows, pipelines, and processes


It’s Great if you have:

Experience with complex analytics and statistical/machine learning techniques using R/Python/Spark
Experience building automated analytical processes and functionality

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others.
Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers.

Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics or science)
Ability to communicate fluently in English
Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau
Good numerical reasoning skills
Proficiency in Excel
Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills

It’s Great if you Have:

Experience in digital marketing
Academic research experience
