detailDescription.711:
About The Role

Fasten your helmet and climb on board if you’re ready to be our next Software Engineer. In this role, you will be an integral player in the Mapan Product Development team based in Jakarta, Indonesia - a team whose efforts are especially catered to aid lower-income users attain additional income through our platform. You'll maintain product quality pre and post release, and employ TestNG, Selenium, and Appium to bolster and enhance the team's products and deliver best-in-class products. You'll have ample opportunity to employ your technical expertise and clean coding skills to deliver tangible solutions that'll bring a positive socioeconomic impact to all who use our app.

What You Will Do
Develop the optimal test case and write clean automation test code for that test case
Gain full knowledge of assigned products and have knowledge of dependent systems interactions
Ensure software quality and maintainability by implementing software engineering best practices
Act as a product quality keeper by attending scrum event meeting for identify requirement and analyze the product flow processes
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders in a clear and timely fashion about product development status
What You Will Need
Strong curiosity to identify edge cases and obscure quality issues
An interest in basic software quality assurance concepts
Experience conducting automated tests on more than one platform: Mobile Web, Android, iOS or Backend API
Up to date with language/frameworks such as Java, Maven, and TestNG
Experience using library: Appium (mobile), Selenium (Web), RestAssured (REST), Apache kafka clients + kafka protobuf serde, Armeria (GRPC)
Data-oriented with strong SQL skills
Familiar with DevOps CI/CD process

About The Team

Our Mapan Software Engineer in Test Team, a subsidiary of GoPay, consists of 5 people based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Working alongside the product and engineering teams, we are predominantly concerned with the lower-end user to get additional income (most of them are moms, yes moms!). For instance, if you're interested in technology's role in empowering communities which lead to more fulfilling lives, we are your people! Our team is constantly busy designing and implementing technology that's sole purpose is to make life more efficient for its users.

Work from home has been a strange time for a lot of us, so our team has been taking time on our calls to trade advice on the best ways to keep sane with this new work set up. We're a very close team made up of bookworms, gamers, coffee drinkers, and Netflix watchers. We look out for one another, and work together to get the job done.

About Us

Gojek is a Super App. It’s one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and dozen other products. It is Indonesia’s first and only decacorn. It's also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'

Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business and MSMEs.

As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion annualised gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia, (outside of China), and the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.

Our investors include Google, Facebook, PayPal, Sequoia Capital, Tencent Holdings among others.

Gojek is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

Company Description
Traveloka is a technology company based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Founded in 2012 by ex-Silicon Valley engineers and aims to revolutionize human mobility with technology. Today Traveloka is expanding its reach by operating in 8 countries and experimenting with new endeavors that will create large impact in the markets and industries we touch.

In Traveloka, you will work in cross-functional teams and meet great people regularly from top tier technology, consulting, product, or academic background. We work in open environment where there are no boundaries or power distance. Everyone is encouraged to speak their mind, propose ideas, influence others, and continuously grow themselves. Get the exposure to multi-aspect, collaborative, intensive startup experience with our recent expansion into Southeast Asia and exploration of new product.

About the Role
As a part or the Local engineering team, you would be working on building highly scalable services that are able to serve location related information and services (e.g: location data, geomapping, geofencing) to all other teams in Traveloka. The domain complexity comes from the sheer scale and the fact that the information requirement from each team may differ. Other than location services, you would be also be working on weather and important dates based services such as holidays or events. You would be closely working with product managers and architects to drive both product and technology innovation.

Responsibilities
As a software engineer in the local team, you would participate in the complete lifecycle of product/feature development from ideation and designing phase to implementation, improvement and support phase. In addition, you will be working with tech leads and product managers to identify user pain points and develop effective, reliable and scalable solutions. You’ll be expected to deliver the best in class architecture, solution and code.

Qualifications
Bachelors' degree in Computer Science or equivalent from a reputable university is preferred
At least 2 years of experience in software engineering, application development, or system development
Expertise in at least one object oriented programming language(preferably Java) and tech stack to write maintainable, scalable, unit-tested code
Knowledge and experience in crafting solutions and build architecture design for a distributed system
Knowledge and experience in AWS/GCP/Azure/Alicloud is a plus
Knowledge and experience in Relational databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL is a plus
Knowledge and experience in Automation and CI/CD is a plus
Knowledge and experience in IAC (infra as a code) using Terraform is a plus
Curiosity to explore creative solutions with strong problem solving and analytical skills
Good interpersonal and communication skills

About the Team
As one of the platform team, local team is responsible for providing all the geography related data and services to different product teams within Traveloka. Just how a 'local' person in Bali area would have knowledge that there is a province called Badung in Bali, the local team would also have these kind of information and solve related problems but at a much larger scale and complexity. Apart from solving complex engineering problems, the local team also enjoys by having gaming nights.
detailDescription.715:
Ninja Van is a late-stage logtech startup that is disrupting a massive industry with innovation and cutting edge technology. Launched 2014 in Singapore, we have grown rapidly to become one of Southeast Asia's largest and fastest-growing express logistics companies. Since our inception, we’ve delivered to 100 million different customers across the region with added predictability, flexibility and convenience. Join us in our mission to connect shippers and shoppers across Southeast Asia to a world of new possibilities.

More About Us
We process 250 million API requests and 3TB of data every day.
We deliver more than 1.5 million parcels every day.
100% network coverage with 1000+ hubs and stations in 6 SEA markets (Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam and Philippines), reaching 500 million consumers.
600,000 active shippers in all e-commerce segments, from the largest marketplaces to the individual social commerce sellers.
Raised US$400 million over four rounds.
We are looking for world-class talent to join our crack team of engineers, product managers and designers. We want people who are passionate about creating software that makes a difference to the world. We like people who are brimming with ideas and who take initiative rather than wait to be told what to do. We prize team-first mentality, personal responsibility and tenacity to solve hard problems and meet deadlines. As part of a small and lean team, you will have a very direct impact on the success of the company.

Role

We are looking for bright interns to join our software engineering team to help design and develop Ninja Van’s core products. Our technology stack includes ELK, Java on Play, Hibernate, Kafka and AKKA on the server, and native Android plus HTML5 and AngularJS on the client. You'll work closely with seasoned software engineers and contribute production code and do 'real' software development.

Requirements

We are looking for really smart people who get things done. We prize creativity, high level of responsibility and maturity to work without close supervision.

Specific technical skills or languages are not required but strong programming skills and hunger to learn are. Out-of-school experiences like winning programming contests, prior internships, open source contribution etc. will make your application stand out.

We will only consider candidates who can commit to at least 3 months of full-time internship.

Tech Stack
Data storage: MySQL, TiDB, Elasticsearch
Cache: Hazelcast, Redis
Real-time data pipeline: Apache Kafka
Backend: Play (Java 8), GoLang, Node.js
Frontend: React, AngularJS
Mobile: Android SDK, Dart (Flutter), React Native
Orchestrator: Kubernetes
Containerization: Docker, Containerd
Cloud Provider: GCP, AWS
Architecture: Micro Services (Frontend and Backend)
Submit a job application

By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

detailDescription.717:
Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike.

Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind — to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.

Billing

As part of the team that designs the billing experience for the customer, you will be tasked with building processes that will impact how Xendit collects fees and charges from the merchant. In designing this system we are looking to minimise the friction involved in settling an invoice. This can be through providing different methods of settling the invoice, providing more flexible payment terms, or creating automated processes that will conveniently settle the billing amount for the merchant without any action needed. As billing performance comes down to how easy and frictionless we can make the experience for the merchant, decreasing the steps needed and procedures in the way of settling an invoice is key to providing a well-rounded billing experience for the customer.

Mission

Accurately and reliably deliver billing solutions for all customers.

Accuracy

The main pillar for our billing documents is the accuracy - as this is the first impression that the merchant can receive in order to build trust with Xendit. When billing documents are correctly calculated with all the fees & charges clearly laid out, the merchant will be able to trust that the billing amount is the right amount.

Creating accurate billing documents requires the ability to handle large volumes of data and understanding the differences between the products that make up the transaction data. In combination with this, the transaction data will need to be manipulated to include the merchant data with agreed rates and any special arrangements. Putting all of these pieces together requires a curiosity to understand how transactions are designed at the product level in order to aggregate them into a convenient and accurate document for the merchant.

Reliability

Every month Xendit Group produces more than a thousand customer invoices for all our merchants and delivers them to customers on a set schedule. Every month the merchant list grows but the set schedule needs to be maintained for internal reporting and customer agreements. To tackle this issue our Billing team builds an iterative robust system that is prepared to scale with our merchant base whilst maintaining reliability of delivery. Problem-solving and investigative traits are a huge asset of being able to evaluate the current system to prepare it for the next iteration and set it in the right standing for scalability.

Responsibilities
Deliver products with standardized security, reliability, and stability Maintaining and improving code standards on repositories
Build products that comply with regulations, given how sensitive financial data are
Design and build solutions for getting the most accurate data possible in a scalable manner across the different products we offer customers Ideate and plan out methods to improve the billing system in preparation for greater scalability and reliability
Automate a customized billing model
Design and build a process that simplifies the settlement experience of merchants
Build tools and procedures to catch inaccuracies early on

You may be a good fit if
You have successful track records of developing quality software products and shipping large production-ready software
You are familiar with any of these programming languages: Javascript, NodeJS, Typescript
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes environments
You have the experience of designing RESTful APIs You are experienced in building advanced SQL queries, and optimize them
You are familiar with Postgresql database design and queries
You have experiences in building unit, integration, and E2E test
You have the ability to mentor and share best practices with other software engineers on your team
You have the ability to break down complex product requirements into well-groomed user stories
You excel working in fast-paced environments with like-minded team-mates


What We Care About
Solve for the customer first: You build what customers want. You think about what is right for customers, not what is easiest for you
Demonstrate mastery of honey badgery: You make ambitious goals. Then execute…no matter what stands in the way. When knocked down, you get up
Take on challenges willingly and can be trusted to execute: You can be trusted to get things done right the first time quickly. You hit your deadlines
You're like us: You smile a lot, think work is fun and don't take yourself too seriously. You measure yourself against the best and believe feedback is the breakfast of champions. You follow the golden rule.
You're remarkable: People naturally talk about how awesome you are. If we can't find someone who raves about you then it's unlikely we will too.

Today Traveloka is expanding its reach by operating in 8 countries and experimenting with new endeavors that will create large impact in the markets and industries we touch.

Software engineering takes the central roles for building Traveloka products and systems. You will be responsible for designing, building, improving, or maintaining our web applications, third-party data integration, data API, backend systems, or working with monitoring tools and infrastructure. You may work on our search engine including scoring and relevance, reservation engine, automated pricing engine, business process engine, data applications, devops-related applications, and other new projects.

You will work in cross-functional teams and meet great people regularly from top tier technology, consulting, product, or academic background. We work in open environment where there are no boundaries or power distance. Everyone is encouraged to speak their mind, propose ideas, influence others, and continuously grow themselves. Get the exposure to multi-aspect, collaborative, intensive startup experience with our recent expansion into Southeast Asia and exploration of new products.

Having minimum 1 year of experience in software engineering, application development or system development
Passion in software engineering, application development, or systems development
Excellent understanding of software engineering concepts, design patterns, and algorithms
Comfortable working up and down the technology stack
Curiosity to explore creative solutions and try new things
Bachelors' degree in Computer Science or equivalent from a reputable university

Database/datastore experience: RDBMS (e,g., Postgresql), basic SQL, cache store (e.g., redis, memcached)
Microservice
Experience working on the Cloud

detailDescription.723:
HappyFresh is the fastest-growing online grocery marketplace in South-East Asia and Asia's Best Company to Work For 2019. Headquartered in Jakarta, we have expanded to major cities in three countries and now operate in Indonesia, Malaysia, and Thailand. Every day, our team delivers the #FreshlyHandpicked quality groceries to thousands of customers.

As a company, we are here to deliver a simplified life by providing an easy grocery shopping experience with a high-quality service. With our HappyFresh Culture, we believe we can achieve our goals with you in it.

In terms of structure, you will be working in a cross-functional and self-organized team. From day one, we believe in “no silos” as an achievable goal. We do need the “right” engineers—those who are willing to collaborate, who value direct feedback, dare to challenge assumptions, and believe in continuous improvement. We know very well that when you create a product for everyone, you have to involve everyone. That is why at HappyFresh, we value inclusion over elitism, skills over credentials.

General Responsibilities
Work in our scrum team to build an online groceries experience for iOS platform
A focus on UI design principles and making apps work intuitively
Analyze and optimize UI and front-end application code for efficiency and performance
Contribute best-in-class programming skills to develop highly innovative, consumer-facing mobile products
Ship efficient, reliable, crash-free code that reaches millions of users

Senior IOs Engineer Key Responsibilities
Works on complex feature sets and breaks them down into smaller tasks in order to speed up customer value delivery
Having a great balance between pace and perfection. Means that, considering the trade-off between the total time spent in creating the perfect code, versus delivering other efficient products
Identify and help other engineers to resolve blockers and support the deliverable
Leading the deliverable of an end-to-end complex feature
Provide technical advice and involve in technical decisions that impact other teams or company at large
Research and propose new technology or engineering practice

Technical Requirements
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, with minimum 5 years working experience in mobile development
Have published one or more iOS apps in the app store
Strong knowledge of Swift and or Objective-C
Strong knowledge of iOS app architecture and frameworks such as UIKit, Core Data, Core Animation, etc
Knowledge and experience of UI layouting, multi-threading, networking, and memory management in iOS
Experience with third-party libraries and APIs and why we should/not to use them
Knowledge and experience in common iOS architecture other than MVC
Working knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architectures, trends, and emerging technologies

General Requirements Senior Engineer
Having an agility mindset, working previously with agile development framework are preferred
Strong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done
Excellent in prioritisation
Intermediate written and verbal communication skills
Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a matrix organization

Perks
Employee discounts: affordable grocery special for HappyFreshers!
Generous medical, dental, and maternity insurance
HappyHealth; allowance provided to HappyFreshers for health activities and health-related items
LinkedIn Learning access for all courses!
Work-from-home days
12 days of paid leave per year, plus additional 1 day off for every work anniversary
HappyFit; a free & fun exercise time along with HappyFreshers inviting professional trainers
HappyMind; a psychological consultation program with experts from Clinician, to keep your mental health in track
Lactation room for working mothers
Occasional celebration for when we achieve something big together!

See what it's like to work here: http://happyfresh.com/careers

detailDescription.726:
Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike.

Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind — to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.

Cards

To facilitate payments acceptance for our customers, Xendit offers a wide range of payment channels. Credit and debit card acceptance is one of the central channels used worldwide, and it's preferred by many merchants because of the widespread usage of credit cards. Businesses who operate (or aim to do so) in multiple countries with customers from across the world need a seamless payment method that can be offered worldwide. Xendit helps our customers accept online payments from any Visa, MasterCard, JCB and AMEX card, regardless of the country where the card is issued.

Mission

The Cards team provides merchants with a payment experience that is used all around the world. We support merchants to accept card payments from their end customers via APIs, frontend clients and plugins. We directly contribute to influencing company growth, improving the Xendit product experience, and building customer trust. We are responsible for integrations with banks and payment processors, and features to enhance the card payment experience. By allowing their customers to pay with cards, merchants can receive payment within seconds!

We regularly explore and adopt new and reliable technologies to build products which delight customers. We aim to provide the most reliable and highest successful rate of credit card payment services in South East Asia.

Responsibilities
Develop our card payments product by providing high-quality maintanable code and accountable for project deployment
Improve our payment infrastructure to ensure reliability and security
Collaborate with tech lead, product manager, and senior engineers to deliver project based performance, availability, reliability, and scalability consideration
Lead more junior engineer within the team to implement best engineering practices
Do whatever it takes to make Xendit succeed

You may be a good fit if
Typescript and Node.js expertise
Knowledge of REST and pub/sub design patterns
Experience with SQL and NoSQL database schema design and query optimization
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS (including serverless approaches)
Familiarity with containerization, including docker and kubernetes
Experience with unit, integration, and E2E test frameworks such as jest, mocha, supertest, and cucumber
Ability to mentor other software engineers on your team
Ability to break down complex product requirements into technical specification document
You feel happy to solve problems and build solutions
Experience working with credit card payment APIs and credit card industry knowledge
Proficiency with Golang, Swift, and Java


What We Care About
Solve for the customer first: You build what customers want. You think about what is right for customers, not what is easiest for you
Demonstrate mastery of honey badgery: You make ambitious goals. Then execute…no matter what stands in the way. When knocked down, you get up
Take on challenges willingly and can be trusted to execute: You can be trusted to get things done right the first time quickly. You hit your deadlines
You're like us: You smile a lot, think work is fun and don't take yourself too seriously. You measure yourself against the best and believe feedback is the breakfast of champions. You follow the golden rule.
You're remarkable: People naturally talk about how awesome you are. If we can't find someone who raves about you then it's unlikely we will too.

Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. You'll get to work with our business and operations teams to understand and solve customer pain points and work with other engineers to build new features that will delight our customers.

detailDescription.733:
Company Description

Traveloka is a technology company based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Founded in 2012 by ex-Silicon Valley engineers and aims to revolutionize human mobility with technology. Today Traveloka is expanding its reach by operating in 8 countries and experimenting with new endeavors that will create large impact in the markets and industries we touch.

In Traveloka, you will work in cross-functional teams and meet great people regularly from top tier technology, consulting, product, or academic background. We work in open environment where there are no boundaries or power distance. Everyone is encouraged to speak their mind, propose ideas, influence others, and continuously grow themselves. Get the exposure to multi-aspect, collaborative, intensive startup experience with our recent expansion into Southeast Asia and exploration of new product.

About The Role

As a part of the Universal Search engineering team, you would be working on some interesting and complex engineering problems to build an efficient search aimed at providing the most relevant and personalized search results to users which drive them to easily and quickly find products within Traveloka. You would be closely working with product managers, architects and designers to drive both product and technology innovation.

Responsibilities

As a Software Engineer in the Universal Search team, you would be working on backend technologies ensuring high quality of Traveloka's Search and Discovery engine. You'll design and implement solutions related to new products/features, business models, business growth and market expansion. In addition, you will be working with tech leads and product managers to identify user pain points and develop effective, reliable and scalable solutions. You'll be expected to deliver the best in class architecture, solution and code.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent from a reputable university with good academic results is preferred.
At least 2 years of experience in software engineering, application development, or system development.
Expertise in at least one object oriented programming language(preferably Java) and tech stack to write maintainable, scalable, unit-tested code
Knowledge and experience in crafting solutions and build architecture design for a distributed system
Knowledge and experience in AWS/GCP/Azure/Alicloud is a plus
Knowledge and experience in Relational databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL is a plus
Knowledge and experience with search technologies like ElasticSearch is a plus
Curiosity to explore creative solutions with strong problem solving and analytical skills
Good interpersonal and communication skills


About The Team

We are a small team with big responsibility where we allow users to quickly find the intended products in Traveloka through a query that can be ambiguous at times. There will be a lot of interesting engineering problems such as providing the most relevant and personalised search results to the users while also taking care of the sheer scale.
detailDescription.734:
Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike.

Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind — to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.

Mission

Our disbursement team works on Xendit's biggest products: xenDisburse and xenBatch. These products support the region's biggest fintech and ecommerce businesses in the high-volume, time-sensitive payouts needed to run their business. The team is responsible for building mission-critical services, maintaining connections to banks and providers, and working through various issues associated with local infrastructure to ensure that payouts are executed successfully, correctly and promptly.

We're looking for a highly passionate software engineer to help us refine our disbursements product so that it is highly scalable, reliable and fault-tolerant. You'll be joining our technical team to build a complex distributed system used by regional customers. You'll get to work with our business and operations teams to understand and solve customer pain points and work with other engineers to build new features that will delight our customers.

Responsibilities
Understand customer needs and requirements, prioritise builds and add those into the technical roadmap
Account for the delivery of technical roadmap items on time
Drive infrastructure improvements that scale us from millions of monthly transactions to tens of millions of monthly transactions
Design and develop REST API to support business requirements
Write high-quality maintainable code, test, PR review then ship it
Deliver products with standardized security, reliability, and stability
Enhance our product reliability to maintain our performance threshold of 99% of disbursements processed under 1 minute & 99% of disbursements successfully sent to the recipient
Work closely with local banks and partners to scale up our product coverage
Do whatever it takes to make Xendit succeed

You may be a good fit if
1+ years of experience in developing, designing, and deploying large scale applications
Bachelor's and/or Master's degree, preferably in CS, or equivalent experience
Experience in any of the following: Node.js, TypeScript, Golang
Familiarity with REST API design and development
Familiarity with relational databases and NoSQL such as Posgres and MongoDB
Familiarity with Scrum development methodologies
Ability to break down complex product requirements into well-groomed user stories
Thrive on being independent and have proven you can push towards a goal by yourself
Communicate well across teams

It would be amazing if you also have
Familiarity with containerization technologies, including docker and kubernetes
Familiarity with cloud infrastructure such as AWS
Experience in building unit, integration, and E2E test


What We Care About
Solve for the customer first: You build what customers want. You think about what is right for customers, not what is easiest for you
Demonstrate mastery of honey badgery: You make ambitious goals. Then execute…no matter what stands in the way. When knocked down, you get up
Take on challenges willingly and can be trusted to execute: You can be trusted to get things done right the first time quickly. You hit your deadlines
You're like us: You smile a lot, think work is fun and don't take yourself too seriously. You measure yourself against the best and believe feedback is the breakfast of champions. You follow the golden rule.
You're remarkable: People naturally talk about how awesome you are. If we can't find someone who raves about you then it's unlikely we will too.

detailDescription.736:
About The Role

Fasten your helmet and climb aboard if you’re ready to be our next Senior Database Administrator (DBA). In this role, you will be an integral player in the Merchant Payment engineering team. You'll take the wheel in implementing, maintaining, optimizing and managing database structures for the payments domain. This includes keeping the database and applications running at tip-top shape in terms of performance, availability, and recovery standards. The folks in the larger Merchant Payment team will be your companions on this ride. Employing your stellar knowledge in database management and configuration practices, you'll lead the software installation, maintenance, database backup, capacity planning, and performance monitoring of Gojek's database infrastructure.

What You Will Do
Provide MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL in clustered and non-clustered configurations
Handle common database procedures, including but not limited to: upgrade, backup, recovery, migration database structure
Build web-scale database Infrastructure operations
Monitor and optimize profile server resource usage
Monitor infrastructure operations for performance, scalability, and reliability
Conduct capacity planning and sizing pitfalls in database infrastructure operations
Create and implement database backup, recovery plans, and disaster recovery strategy to ensure data reliability
Lead multiple infrastructure planning and implementation, including optimal database strategy, technical platform selection, architecture design, and backup & recovery strategy
What You Will Need
At least 3 years of experience as a database engineer
Strong proficiency in MySQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Percona XtraDB Cluster database management
An understanding of MySQL’s underlying storage engines, such as InnoDB and Xtradb
Experience with replication configuration in MySQL
Knowledge of de-facto standards, best practices, and limitations of MySQL and their workarounds in contrast to other popular relational database
Proficiency in writing and optimizing SQL statements
Ability to plan resource requirements from high level specifications
Familiarity with other SQL/NoSQL databases, such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB

About The Team

Our Merchant Payment DBA team is a small family of 5 database administrators based in Jakarta, Indonesia. As sate ayam is to the people of Indonesia, we are to Gojek: providing the nourishment to sustain our business from the inside out. We handle all variants of open source databases, including MySQL, MongoDB, and PostgreSQL. Our main responsibility is to oversee all payment related database tasks. How does one achieve this, you may ask? By offering 24/7 timely support and keeping frequent checks on new tickets that come in. For instance, once we get an incident/request/task, we share our responses on pager duty to get it resolved ASAP. The motto "teamwork makes the dream work" is our motto; we're all driven by our shared sense of purpose, and helping each other get the work done and done well. We're currently working on supporting multiple payment solutions projects that are in the pipeline.

As a team, we’re concerned with the growth of the company, and each other’s personal growth and well-being, too; we enjoy bonding over our shared love of standup meetings, and random catch-ups where we discuss anything and everything under the sun. More recently, with WFH becoming a norm for us, we've been sharing our favorite ways of enjoying our time at home, which includes lots of easy recipes to try, interesting shows to watch, and good books to read.

About Us

Gojek is a Super App. It’s one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and dozen other products. It is Indonesia’s first and only decacorn. It's also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'

Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business and MSMEs.

As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion annualised gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia, (outside of China), and the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.

Our investors include Google, Facebook, PayPal, Sequoia Capital, Tencent Holdings among others.

Gojek is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

detailDescription.738:
About The Role

As our Product Manager for the Risk and Compliance Platform, you'll take the wheel in leading the Risk stream that oversees our Driver Platform. You'll also collaborate extensively with Data Scientists, Data Analysts, Product Managers, and Engineers on the Risk and Platform team to detect and prevent fraudulent and/or abusive behaviors to ensure a trusted and fair platform for our driver-partners. Ranging from building location spoofing detection to biometric authentication using Facial Recognition, you'll get to design and scale world-class risk and compliance products from scratch, and see the effects of your efforts in people's every day lives.

What You Will Do
Define and drive the strategy, roadmap, and OKRs for the Risk and Compliance Platform team across the company that supports Gojek’s philosophy of iterative product mindset, while prioritizing the improvement of customer, driver partner, and merchant partner trust, and minimizing loss due to fraud
Define product metrics that measure the product success and progress of key stakeholders
Drive strategic communications for the Risk product vision and roadmap, and relay progress to key stakeholders across the company
Translate the needs of business and product teams into technical requirements and user stories that engineering and design teams rely on to build products
Identify any critical gaps, and collaborate with relevant product teams to fill these gaps in and prevent future ones from forming
Build strategic partnerships with third-party companies, and understand when to build and when to buy
Be the product evangelist for the Anti-Fraud products across the company and drive product adoption
Influence Risk Data and Machine Learning Platform roadmap that delivers real-time pattern and probabilistic decision systems
What You Will Need
At least 4 years of working experience, with at least 2 years of Product Management experience
Freethinking and proactive attitude; able to take ownership, ask for help, and learn continuously
Strong problem-solving skills and a data-oriented mindset; able to rely on data to understand various happenings and define & measure success on every project
An entrepreneurial attitude; comfortable working in a complex and fast-paced environment
A customer-oriented mindset
Able to assuredly and clearly communicate your thoughts
Experience as a software engineer/developer and working with distributed teams is a huge plus
Experience in any of these industries is highly desired: fraud prevention in the ride-hailing industry, payments, e-commerce, financial services industry

About The Team

Our Risk and Compliance platform team is a talented family of engineers, analysts, product managers and data scientists stationed across Jakarta, Singapore, Vietnam and Thailand. The safety of Gojek’s platform is our top priority; our efforts impact the user experience and financials, among many other things. We play a critical role in ensuring the most credible and reliable tech platform for our users, driver partners, and merchant partners in our ecosystem. Partnering closely with the Risk Organization, subject matter experts, product managers, and engineers, we work to deliver bold solutions to reduce fraud and abuse on the platform. We also enable the Product teams to save money & ensure enhanced user experiences through our microservices, automation(s), and analytical services.

We’re a high-performing, tight-knit team who are committed to the safety and growth of the company, as well as each other’s personal growths and wellbeing. Pre-Covid, factions of our team would enjoy catching up over a round of drinks after work. However, with WFH becoming more normalized, we've been sharing our favorite ways to prioritize a healthy work-life balance at home. This includes ample “fun” Zoom calls where we discuss our latest tech-related findings we find interesting.

About Us

Gojek is a Super App. It’s one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and dozen other products. It is Indonesia’s first and only decacorn. It's also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'

Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business and MSMEs.

As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion annualised gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia, (outside of China), and the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.

Our investors include Google, Facebook, PayPal, Sequoia Capital, Tencent Holdings among others.

Gojek is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

detailDescription.741:
Company Description

Traveloka is a technology company based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Founded in 2012 by ex-Silicon Valley engineers and aims to revolutionize human mobility with technology. Today Traveloka is expanding its reach by operating in 8 countries and experimenting with new endeavors that will create large impact in the markets and industries we touch.

In Traveloka, you will work in cross-functional teams and meet great people regularly from top tier technology, consulting, product, or academic background. About The Role

As a part or the Local engineering team, you would be working on building highly scalable services that are able to serve location related information and services (e.g: location data, geomapping, geofencing) to all other teams in Traveloka. The domain complexity comes from the sheer scale and the fact that the information requirement from each team may differ. Other than location services, you would be also be working on weather and important dates based services such as holidays or events. You would be closely working with product managers and architects to drive both product and technology innovation.

Responsibilities

As a software engineer in the local team, you would participate in the complete lifecycle of product/feature development from ideation and designing phase to implementation, improvement and support phase. In addition, you will be working with tech leads and product managers to identify user pain points and develop effective, reliable and scalable solutions. You'll be expected to deliver the best in class architecture, solution and code.

Qualifications
Bachelors' degree in Computer Science or equivalent from a reputable university is preferred
At least 2 years of experience in software engineering, application development, or system development
Expertise in at least one object oriented programming language(preferably Java) and tech stack to write maintainable, scalable, unit-tested code
Knowledge and experience in crafting solutions and build architecture design for a distributed system
Knowledge and experience in AWS/GCP/Azure/Alicloud is a plus
Knowledge and experience in Relational databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL is a plus
Knowledge and experience in Automation and CI/CD is a plus
Knowledge and experience in IAC (infra as a code) using Terraform is a plus
Curiosity to explore creative solutions with strong problem solving and analytical skills
Good interpersonal and communication skills


About The Team

As one of the platform team, local team is responsible for providing all the geography related data and services to different product teams within Traveloka. Just how a 'local' person in Bali area would have knowledge that there is a province called Badung in Bali, the local team would also have these kind of information and solve related problems but at a much larger scale and complexity. Apart from solving complex engineering problems, the local team also enjoys by having gaming nights.
detailDescription.742:
Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike.

Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind — to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.

Virtual Accounts

The Virtual Account product is the second top TPV contributor in Xendit and many merchants have been using our product to collect money as their preferable method. We are connected to popular banks in Indonesia (e.g. BNI, MANDIRI, BRI, PERMATA), and we are intending to add more bank channels based on customer needs. With the high volumes and frequency of Virtual Account payments, we have some unique challenges:
Scaling our system to reliably handle high loads of traffic of account creations / updates and payments.
Build and onboard new bank channels quickly within a strict timeline (< 1 week) to meet customer requirements
Implementing and audit and reconciliation system to automatically process failed or delayed payment notifications from the bank. This helps to reduce the amount of manual work for our Customer Service teams.
End to end conception, development and deployment and monitoring of systems. This ensures we have ownership of the software systems and we are responsible for detecting and resolving issues within seconds.
Refactor and migrate legacy systems using best practices and system designs to reduce technical debt and increase system extensibility and scalability using Golang to scale 100X.

Mission

Provide the most reliable virtual account services in South East Asia

The Virtual Account team provides merchants with a seamless bank transfer payment experience. We support merchants to accept payments from their end customers via APIs, and callback notifications. Our scope and responsibilities are influencing company growth, product experience, and customer trust. We are responsible for integration with banks to enable Virtual Account payments for merchants. With our technologies, merchants can receive payment notifications and money within seconds!

We are open to explore, and adopt new and reliable technologies to solve customer problems and make Xendit succeed. We aim to provide the most reliable virtual account services in South East Asia through reducing technical debts, minimise customer issues, and increase product reliability.

Responsibilities
Improve the Virtual Account system reliability, and scalability so that the product will survive in the long term, easy to maintain, and easy to deploy
Collaborate with tech lead, and engineers to deliver project based performance, availability, reliability, and scalability consideration
Manage Virtual Account technical roadmap to ensure we meet team metrics, and achieve goals
Take ownership for major/crucial projects which will take significant impact to customers
Mentor engineers and team to consistently follow best engineering practices

You may be a good fit if
Experience in Node JS (Typescript, Javascript), Golang as programming language
Experience in NoSQL and SQL database
Experience in CI/CD technology
Experience in AWS EKS, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, AWS EC2, Docker, Kubernetes, and GCP as infrastructure platform technology
Experience in UNIX family operating system
Experience in implement unit, integration, and API tests
Familiar with Scrum/Agile as development methodologies
Experience working with bank payment APIs
Familiarity with developing or refactoring legacy code into microservices
Proficient in scalable and sustainable architectural designs


What We Care About
Solve for the customer first: You build what customers want. You think about what is right for customers, not what is easiest for you
Demonstrate mastery of honey badgery: You make ambitious goals. Then execute…no matter what stands in the way. When knocked down, you get up
Take on challenges willingly and can be trusted to execute: You can be trusted to get things done right the first time quickly. You hit your deadlines
You're like us: You smile a lot, think work is fun and don't take yourself too seriously. You measure yourself against the best and believe feedback is the breakfast of champions. You follow the golden rule.
You're remarkable: People naturally talk about how awesome you are. If we can't find someone who raves about you then it's unlikely we will too.

Software engineering takes the central roles for building Traveloka products and systems. You will be responsible for designing, building, improving, or maintaining our web applications, third-party data integration, data API, backend systems, or working with monitoring tools and infrastructure. You may work on our search engine including scoring and relevance, reservation engine, automated pricing engine, business process engine, data applications, devops-related applications, and other new projects.

You will work in cross-functional teams and meet great people regularly from top tier technology, consulting, product, or academic background. We work in open environment where there are no boundaries or power distance. Everyone is encouraged to speak their mind, propose ideas, influence others, and continuously grow themselves. Get the exposure to multi-aspect, collaborative, intensive startup experience with our recent expansion into Southeast Asia and exploration of new products.

Qualifications
Bachelors' degree in Computer Science or equivalent from a reputable university
Having minimum 3 years of experience in software engineering, application development or system development
Passion in software engineering, application development, or systems development
Excellent understanding of software engineering concepts, design patterns, and algorithms
Comfortable working up and down the technology stack
Curiosity to explore creative solutions and try new things
Knowledge and experience with Java is a definite plus
Knowledge and experience in AWS/GCP/Azure/Alicloud is a plus
Knowledge and experience in crafting solutions and build architecture design for a distributed system

Traveloka is hiring for Backend Engineers across various business units in our engineering team. Our recruitment team will be in touch with you to explain the available vacancies to shortlisted candidates.
detailDescription.746:
About The Role

If you’re looking to be a part of a dynamic, highly-analytical team who enjoys building creative solution for users, look no further. As a Lead Software Engineer for GoMerchant, you will be handed the reins in delivering values for the customers along with deep technical expertise for Gojek. Along with collaboration with the business and products, you will be in charge of system design and create technical solution. Working closely with engineering manager and engineers, you will even get to driving innovation to improve the engineering process. The cherry on top: you’ll get to be a part of a team that works to provide a secure and reliable payment ecosystem for all Gojek's merchants.

What You Will Do
Own design, strategy, and quality of software development for Merchant Payment
Translate objectives into iterative MVPs, evaluate and then refactor into a scalable and extensible design
Design & develop highly scalable, reliable, secure and fault-tolerant systems and code base with minimal guidance
Research new technologies and tools to optimize development efficiency and improve customer experience
What You Will Need
Should have at least 6 years of relevant software development experience with consumer/enterprise products with hands-on experience in designing, developing, testing, and deploying large-scale applications
Proficient in OOP, SQL, Design Patterns and software best practices
Possess data modeling experience in Relational and NoSQL databases
Experience in troubleshooting server performance - such as memory issues, GC tuning, and resource leaks
Well-versed with Agile methodologies, TDD, CI/CD, and Test Engineering Automation
Able to design and implement low latency RESTful/GRPC services & experience in Golang/Ruby/Clojure/Java (and a willingness to learn others) & infra-related such as: Chef, Docker, Kubernetes, and Kafka
Excellent understanding of interactive application development paradigm, memory management, performance/resource optimizations, database interactions, network programming, concurrency and multithreading, fault tolerance, monitoring, security, and operability of systems
Possess knowledge in high level system architecture design and low level details on how framework/platform works

About The Team

Our GoMerchant squad currently consists of passionate engineers based in Jakarta, Singapore, and Gurgaon who run Southeast Asia’s leading selling platform for online and onsite merchants. We oversee all things related to empowering business owners and work to create payment gateway solution. It’s our job to ensure that our merchants received payment seamlessly using 10+ payment channel ranging from card acceptance to convenience stores. The big question that we’re always trying to solve is: How to create more smooth and safe digital experience to our merchants?

While our team is based all over the region, we are a tight-knit group who are bonded by two things: good technology and good bread 🙌. For real - our weekly conversations range from the latest breakthroughs in mobile technology to the best sourdough bread recipes out there (WFH has indeed made us into make-believe bread connoisseurs). But whether you like your bread with butter or olive oil, or stay as far away from it as possible (teach us how), we’d be stoked to have you join the fam!

About Us

Gojek is a Super App. It’s one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and dozen other products. It is Indonesia’s first and only decacorn. It's also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'

Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business and MSMEs.

As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion annualised gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia, (outside of China), and the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.

Our investors include Google, Facebook, PayPal, Sequoia Capital, Tencent Holdings among others.

Gojek is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

detailDescription.748:
Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike.

Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind — to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.

P2P payment platform team is a new team under Xendit group that focuses on building payment platforms for P2P merchants to comply with Indonesia regulations (OJK). Beside regulations, our product focuses on building payment platforms by giving fast and reliable multiple payment channels and providing money transfer capabilities. Currently our team give around 15% TPV from total TPV in Xendit which is quite huge for a new product/vertical.

In this team we always challenged by:
Reliability - we are expected by customer to ship the most reliable product where it should has close to 0 issues
Payment channels - to expand our product and delight our customer by providing more channels to accept payment
Compliance - every built that we do, we need to make sure everything aligned with what regulators expected
Thousands customers - as the nature of P2P, it has multiples end-customer (up to thousands) that we need to handle
Scalability - in order to handle millions transactions monthly, our team challenged to build system that scalable

Mission

Build fast, reliable, secure and regulation comply platform for P2P merchants in Indonesia

The P2P Payment Platform product is expected to build exciting products for P2P merchants by providing various unique and customised features for the P2P industry. Currently, the focus is on integrating and enabling new payment channels, standardising our APIs to be simpler and robust. There will be countless opportunities for software engineers to build the best P2P merchant platform in Indonesia.

There are several challenges that adds to the excitement. One of them is that we are expected to comply with financial regulations in Indonesia (OJK), placing us in a great position to understand and deliver requirements between stakeholders such as P2P merchants and the regulation bodies.

Another main technical challenge is to increase the speed, reliability, scalability and security of our product using various efficient testing and monitoring tools to improve code, reduce tech debt and design scalable solutions to serve all P2P merchants in Indonesia.

Responsibilities
Understand customer needs and requirements, prioritise build based on customer impact.
Contribute on team technical roadmap, execution and make sure roadmap delivered on time.
Produce and make sure team delivery has high quality and comply with regulations.
Contribute to remittance product scalability, reliability and security improvements.
Leverage team engineering skill by knowledge sharing and actively improve your own knowledge to follow best practices.
Able to consistently give structured feedback and direction to peers and accept any feedback for the sake of growth.
Do whatever it takes to make Xendit group succeed.

You may be a good fit if
Successful track record of developing quality software products and shipping production-ready software in a fast growing environment.
1+ years of experience in developing, designing, and deploying large scale applications
Successful track record of making sure the product meets the company standards, and delivered on time.
Expertise on JavaScript and familiarity with TypeScript and GoLang.
Familiarity with REST and pub/sub design patterns.
Experience with relational and NoSQL database schema design and query optimization.
Experience with unit, integration, and E2E test frameworks such as jest, mocha, supertest, and cucumber.
Familiarity with with Scrum/Agile development methodologies.
Familiarity with cloud computing services such as AWS/GCP/Alicloud.
Familiarity with monitoring tools such as Datadog, Sentry, and Splunk.
Strong desire to independently learn engineering skills and share it with other software engineers.
Loves challenges and problem solving.
Cares deeply about building for customers and improving the customer experience for a product.
Experience with problem solving using Root Cause Analysis
Experience with writing code documentation
Strong communication skills for problem solving as a team


What We Care About
Solve for the customer first: You build what customers want. You think about what is right for customers, not what is easiest for you
Demonstrate mastery of honey badgery: You make ambitious goals. Then execute…no matter what stands in the way. When knocked down, you get up
Take on challenges willingly and can be trusted to execute: You can be trusted to get things done right the first time quickly. You hit your deadlines
You're like us: You smile a lot, think work is fun and don't take yourself too seriously. You measure yourself against the best and believe feedback is the breakfast of champions. You follow the golden rule.
You're remarkable: People naturally talk about how awesome you are. If we can't find someone who raves about you then it's unlikely we will too.
detailDescription.749:
Company Description

Traveloka is a technology company based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Founded in 2012 by ex-Silicon Valley engineers and aims to revolutionize human mobility with technology. Today Traveloka is expanding its reach by operating in 8 countries and experimenting with new endeavors that will create large impact in the markets and industries we touch.

About The Role

As Software Engineer in Marketing Tech, you will work with Product Manager and collaborate with other team in order to build a robust platform that serves multiple Products in Traveloka. You are encouraged to shape requirements with your stakeholders and drive both product and technology innovation. You will experience how to develop and operate high traffic application using micro-service architecture and agile methodology, as well as engage in huge amount of data to give the best result.

Job Descriptions
Drive the story development by pairing with team members on functional and nonfunctional requirements
Design and develop highly scalable, highly available, reliable, secure and fault tolerant systems with minimal guidance
Collaborate with other business teams (Flight, Accom, Platform, Data, etc.) on planning and execution
Build and manage automated build/test/deployment environments
Ensure and maintain code quality and automated test coverage within the team
Own the entire lifecycle of feature development, test, deployment, fixes and improvements


Qualifications
Strong software engineering skills in Java involving extensive design and coding.
Experience in Unit Test Tools like Mockito, Junit/TestNG
Knowledge in RDBMS like PostgreSQL/MySQL and NoSQL databases like MongoDB/Redis.
Knowledge in CI/CD architecture and in IAC (infra as a code) using Terraform
Knowledge of tools like Sonarqube, Maven, GitHub, Datadog is preferred
Knowledge and experience in Cloud Architecture (AWS & GCP) is preferred
Knowledge and experience in Web (nodejs, react, react native) is preferred

We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. While accepting payments digitally has become easier, it is extremely challenging for platforms to manage payments across multiple parties (e.g. suppliers, vendors). Our team streamlines accepting and sending money for platform businesses. Our solutions enable platforms and marketplaces to onboard new partners, route and split payments, and easily monitor their payments infrastructure.

Design, build, and maintain our payments products with a focus on customer needs

Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies

Experience in leading software engineering teams in a technical leadership capacity
Experience working with payment APIs
Familiarity with containerization, including Docker and Kubernetes

detailDescription.752:
Xendit provides payment infrastructure across Southeast Asia, with a focus on Indonesia and the Philippines. We process payments, power marketplaces, disburse payroll and loans, provide KYC solutions, prevent fraud, and help businesses grow exponentially. We serve our customers by providing a suite of world-class APIs, eCommerce platform integrations, and easy to use applications for individual entrepreneurs, SMEs, and enterprises alike.

Our main focus is building the most advanced payment rails for Southeast Asia, with a clear goal in mind — to make payments across in SEA simple, secure and easy for everyone. We serve thousands of businesses ranging from SMEs to multinational enterprises, and process millions of transactions monthly. We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.

Mission

The fraud team is building innovative fraud prevention products with the aim of securing online payments for businesses across Southeast Asia. By leveraging AI and machine learning on the vast amounts of transactional and identity data collected across the years, we are well positioned to help reduce the :USD 300 million (1.6% of revenue) in losses due to fraud experienced by Southeast Asia's businesses. This will help businesses focus on growth without fearing about losses due to fraud.

Engineers in the fraud team are responsible for building data-driven products that involve feature engineering on top of real-time transaction data, building and deployment of fraud detection ML models as well as design and implementation of microservices to support our fraud detection system.

We are looking to expand the suite of features for our fraud detection product and are looking for passionate engineers who have a deep interest in data, applied sciences or machine learning to join our team in building a scalable fraud prevention product for Southeast Asia. Join us if you would like to contribute to our cause in making the payment space safer and free of fraud and abuse.

Responsibilities
Build, maintain, improve and own microservices that support our fraud detection systems to ensure high reliability and security
Integrate with third party APIs to enhance our fraud detection system
Maintaining and building new features for Xendit's chargeback management system
Improving our fraud detection system to be able to process complex fraud rules involving different parameters which will provide merchants more flexibility in tuning their fraud detection performance
Collaborating with tech lead, product manager, and engineers to deliver feature based on considerations around system performance, availability, reliability, and scalability
Do whatever it takes to make Xendit succeed

You may be a good fit if
Experience in at least two of the following : Go, Python, Node.js (Typescript, Javascript)
Experience in SQL and NoSQL databases (Postgres, MongoDB)
Experience in AWS EKS / Kubernetes, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, AWS EC2, and Docker as infrastructure platform technology
Experience in implementing unit, integration, end-to-end, and API tests
Experience in refactoring
Experience in CI/CD technology
Experience in analysing large datasets (SQL, Spark, Python, R, etc.)
Familiarity with Scrum as a development methodology
Have a great sense of end-to-end ownership of the products and tools you build
Experience building features involving real-time data processing systems (Kafka, Spark Streaming, Faust, Beam, Storm etc.)
Experience in developing, designing, and maintaining scalable data-driven applications
Experience with payment fraud detection systems
Track record on upscaling your skills

detailDescription.756:
Job Description

At Koltiva we rely on powerfully insightful data to inform our systems and solutions—and we’re seeking an experienced pipeline-centric data engineer to put it to use. You’ll wear many hats in this role, but much of your focus will be building out our ETL processes, writing superb SQL and managing Data Infrastructure. We’re looking for someone willing to jump right in to help the company get the most out of our data.

Responsibilities
Use agile software development processes to iteratively make improvements to our back end systems
Analyze and organize raw data.
Evaluate business needs and objectives
Conduct complex data analysis and report on results.
Work closely with our data science to help build complex algorithms that provide unique insights into our data.
Model front end and back end data sources to help draw a more comprehensive picture of user flows throughout our system and enable powerful data analysis.
Build data pipelines that clean, transform, and aggregate data from disparate sources.
Develop models that can be used to make predictions and answer questions for the overall business.
Combine raw information from different sources.
Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability.
Identify opportunities for data acquisition.
Develop analytical tools and programs.


Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Majoring Information Technology or equivalent.
Minimum 3 years of experience as a Java Software Engineer, Data Engineer or similar role.
Minimum 3 or more years of experience with Python, SQL, and data visualization/exploration tools.
Familiarity with the AWS ecosystem.
Experience building or maintaining ETL processes.
Have an understanding or experience of Kafka or other Messaging technology is a plus.
Communication skills, especially explaining technical concepts to non-technical business leaders.
Ability to prioritize and multitask. Flexibility and adaptability in work approach.
Ability to perform effective interaction with a broad range of people and roles.

We've been growing rapidly since our inception in 2015, onboarding hundreds of new customers every month, and backed by global top-10 VCs. We're proud to be featured on among the fastest growing companies by Y-Combinator.

Cards

To facilitate payments acceptance for our customers, Xendit offers a wide range of payment channels. Credit and debit card acceptance is one of the central channels used worldwide, and it's preferred by many merchants because of the widespread usage of credit cards. Businesses who operate (or aim to do so) in multiple countries with customers from across the world need a seamless payment method that can be offered worldwide. Xendit helps our customers accept online payments from any Visa, MasterCard, JCB and AMEX card, regardless of the country where the card is issued.

Mission

The Cards team provides merchants with a payment experience that is used all around the world. We support merchants to accept card payments from their end customers via APIs, frontend clients and plugins. We directly contribute to influencing company growth, improving the Xendit product experience, and building customer trust. We are responsible for integrations with banks and payment processors, and features to enhance the card payment experience. By allowing their customers to pay with cards, merchants can receive payment within seconds!

We regularly explore and adopt new and reliable technologies to build products which delight customers. We aim to provide the most reliable and highest successful rate of credit card payment services in South East Asia.

Responsibilities
Develop our card payments product by providing high-quality maintanable code and accountable for project deployment
Improve our payment infrastructure to ensure reliability and security
Collaborate with tech lead, product manager, and engineers to deliver project based performance, availability, reliability, and scalability consideration
Lead and mentor more junior engineer within the team to implement best engineering practices
Work with internal teams such as data analysts to provide insights into payments behavior and trends
Do whatever it takes to make Xendit succeed

You may be a good fit if
A successful track record of developing quality software products and shipping production-ready software
Typescript and Node.js expertise
Strong knowledge of REST and pub/sub design patterns
Experience with relational and NoSQL database schema design and query optimization
Ability to architect distributed systems on cloud computing platforms such as AWS (including serverless approaches)
Familiarity with containerization, including docker and kubernetes
Experience with unit, integration, and E2E test frameworks such as jest, mocha, supertest, and cucumber
Ability to mentor and level up other software engineers on your team
Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies
Ability to break down complex product requirements into well-groomed user stories
You feel happy to solve problems and build solutions
Experience working with credit card payment APIs and credit card industry knowledge
Proficiency with Golang, Swift, and Java
Ability to guide a team through refactoring high-throughput legacy code
