detailDescription.1237:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Design team is a diverse group of product designers and researchers that help to build Agoda’s products from our home office in Bangkok, Thailand. Being a product-driven company, we constantly partner with product managers and engineers to understand customer problems and design workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces. There is always an opportunity for growth here. Focus on your craft to improve or expand your skillset, or step into a managerial role and flex your talents as a designer and driver of team projects. The opportunity and timing are now if you wish to come into a team that’s small enough to be scrappy and hands on, yet big enough to influence change and product strategy. Be a part of Agoda’s Design team and unlock the world for our global community of travelers.

The Opportunity:

A strong candidate will relish the opportunity to jump into a highly visible workstream that drives significant impact. You are an empathetic people manager, a thought leader, and skilled in design operations management. Additionally, you’re gifted in UI design, are customer-centered, and love turning quantitative and qualitative findings into insights and strategy to drive product priorities.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

Manage and grow a team of designers which will require setting clear goals and expectations, resourcing designers accordingly, ensuring KPIs are met and setting up team members for overall success.
Manage the development of team members through dedicated mentorship, or less formal coaching and advice.
Cultivate a collaborative environment for great design by helping with team processes like critiques, team meetings, etc. and identify opportunities to improve how we work
Collaborate with director of product, product managers, developers, content strategists, user researchers, and other experience designers to execute design concepts that deliver on brand goals, business goals, and are technically feasible to implement
Communicate with data to influence and persuade with the objective to drive change,
Day-to-day work will consist of a combination of product leadership, design execution, people management, and design operations management.
Demonstrate strong leadership and communication skills. Be a thought leader who can take a step back on overarching goals and opportunities, while also acting as a product practitioner who can meticulously work alongside his/her teams with domain knowledge and design prowess.


What you’ll Need to Succeed:

3+ years of experience managing and growing a team of designers
8+ years of Design experience for consumers and consumer brands
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Information Architecture, or related field.
Exceptional interpersonal, collaborative, and creative problem-solving skills.
Strong understanding of design processes; knowledge of what is possible and what will be hard to achieve and/or implement in a digital environment.
Expertise in producing relevant deliverables, including detailed site maps, user flows/task flows, user journeys, page flows, taxonomies/folksonomies, paths to purchase, wireframes, annotations, and prototypes that represent interaction recommendations, etc.
An online portfolio of case studies that demonstrates unfailing advocacy for the user, highlighting: product design work, mobile design work, analytical decision-making, design operations, people management, and strategic thinking.


It’s Great if you have:

Experience in OTAs, e-commerce or product driven companies

The Opportunity

Agoda is using a wide range of systems and tools like Workday, Zendesk, Greenhouse, etc. to support its People operations and dynamic workforce needs globally. We are looking for an People Technology Senior Specialist or Specialist to drive projects and implement solutions at scale to simplify work, automate repetitive tasks, and optimize business processes. Has strong project management skills

Bachelor’s degree and fluency in English required

detailDescription.1249:
About The Role

As our Junior Business Intelligence Analyst for the Merchant platform, you’ll collaborate with other cross-functional teams (Product Managers, Business Strategist, Marketing, Research, and Data Science) to find useful business insights within a large amount of data. You’ll assist these teams in setting up success metrics for particular products/features, optimize existing services and systems, and ensure data quality and source of truth availability.

On a daily basis, you’ll process data streams to produce data foundation, analytical dashboards, and product / feature trackers. Here, you'll get a front row seat in understanding how one of the largest Asian SuperApps makes use of its data. Your efforts will help remove highly-complex analytical blockers presented to the team, and contribute to the overall expansion and efficiency of Gojek's Merchant platform.

What You Will Do
Act as a thought partner/collaborate with cross functional stakeholders in helping the team set the success metrics for particular products/features, optimize existing services and systems, and ensure data quality and source of truth availability
Drive data-driven decision making and practices within the cross-functional team through strong project management practices
Independently execute root cause analysis to solve the issues impacting product or feature roll-out to serve our merchants-partners better
Continuously improve and govern the foundational data context that supports the end-to-end product through enforcing strong data management practices and challenging the system development and business process which negatively impacts the trust to our data context; develop or establish the policy to govern internal stakeholders when required
Develop required self-serving analytics tools (i.e. data mart, dashboard, tracker) with proper data modelling to democratize data for our stakeholders; establish required data acquisition and pipeline to build the self-serving analytics tools by driving product and data warehouse counterparts
Evaluate product experiments and measure the impact to our North Star metric (e.g. proactively suggest A/B tests or experimentations for product features and evaluate the impact on whether to increase the exposure or to stop the experiment)

What You Will Need
At least 2 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Product Analytics, or System/ Business Analytics (within these industries is a plus: B2B, tech consultancy, or in a hyper-growth tech company)
Experience in master data management and data migration best-practices are a must
Excellent problem-solving and process thinking skills
Well-versed with SQL (primarily analytics function) and Python for analysis in cloud environments (Google Bigquery)
Good understanding and experience in data modelling, ETL, data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Tableau / Metabase / Google Data Studio)
Comfortable using statistical/mathematical approaches to solve analytical problems
Experience with Clevertap / Google Analytics is a big plus

About The Team

The Merchant Platform team is a big group of over 50 team members based across Singapore and Indonesia. The gist of our role is to create an ecosystem of solutions to support our merchant-partners on the Gojek platform better manage and grow their business, while enabling both internal and external product stakeholders to develop merchant-based solutions in a sustainable manner.

Our merchant-partners are one of the core stakeholders in our Gojek ecosystem; they’re involved in various offerings such as food delivery, offline payment acceptance, POS, financial services, deals, and promotions. As the Merchant Platform team, we work closely with our merchant-partners to understand their daily needs and concerns, and relay these insights to our internal product stakeholders to build platforms and interfaces on our mobile apps that ensure our merchant-partners’ success on the Gojek platform. Should you have a question about how to run processes in the development of merchant-partner products, we are your people! Currently, our team has been hard at work tackling issues within the engineering arena to enhance the experience our merchant-partners have utilizing our platform and services. We aim to establish Gojek as the most trusted partner for all our merchant-partners.

We’re a tight-knit, high-functioning team who genuinely love what we do, as we can see the results of our efforts play out in our merchant-partners’ everyday lives. When we aren’t working, you’d probably find us with our nose in books, or our eyes glued to the TV screen watching the latest Netflix drama. We’re equally concerned with each others’ personal and professional developments, and work together to get our job done well.

About Us

Gojek is a Super App. It’s one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and dozen other products. It is Indonesia’s first and only decacorn. It's also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'

Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business and MSMEs.

As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion annualised gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia, (outside of China), and the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.

Our investors include Google, Facebook, PayPal, Sequoia Capital, Tencent Holdings among others.

Gojek is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

detailDescription.1250:
About Us

Ula is reimagining how retail in emerging markets should work in the smartphone era. We’ve witnessed the rise of B2C e-commerce over the last decade in both India and Indonesia. But the small retailer, the heart and soul of retail, has been left largely underserved by e-commerce even though they’re spending hours every day on their smartphones. Ula provides a simple front-end app, powered by sophisticated back-end systems that determine everything from pricing to inventory to intelligent salesforce route planning. We are building many first of their kind technologies in the world and need your help in building the right systems.

Ula is an under-the-radar, early-stage technology start-up headquartered in Singapore, with offices in Bangalore and Jakarta though we are quite flexible in terms of where our colleagues choose to work from. We are funded by Tier-1 Venture Capital — Sequoia Capital India, Lightspeed India, Quona Capital and B-Capital Group. It is also backed by prominent industry angels such as the founders of Udaan, Rahul Mehta of DST Capital and other established Indonesian angels.

We are a culturally diverse company with 38% women and 7 nationalities. We believe that the best minds are required to solve tough problems irrespective of where they come from.

About You

You are driven to solve tough problems with technology. Let’s take pricing for example. Imagine a world where each product in e-commerce were to be priced differently for each customer based on where they are located, how much they buy or where they prepay or pay-later. This leads to a massive optimization problem because pricing too low incurs opportunity cost while pricing too high means a competitor takes that business. This is just one example of how B2B and B2C e-commerce are different and why B2B offers the opportunity to innovate. Now couple this with routing for a sales agent. How should pricing work with a sales-person’s CRM app? Depending on how far you take it, it is a massive machine learning problem.

If you’re passionate about technology and its applications to business problems, you’re curious and imagine what a new world can look like, love working with global colleagues on global problems and don’t mind taking risks that move the needle and treat failure merely as an opportunity to improve and iterate, you’d be a good fit at Ula.

We are very ownership driven at Ula. We also believe in proactive mentorship. It’s an opportunity to learn and to mentor. Below is what we expect from you.

Responsibilities
Reporting to the CTO, oversee and budget for the company’s various data systems; understand, develop and drive our long-term data strategy as an organization
Ensure that the Data Organization’s reporting on business-critical KPIs are timely and correct, to enable decision making by the Leadership Team
Lead a team of Data Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists and align their outputs to support the objectives of the company
Define and communicate data management, privacy, access and security policies, across the company
Liaise with Engineering leaders to ensure business processes remain intact as they iterate on the underlying platform
Support senior stakeholders across the company to increase proper data adoption
Look for opportunities to improve existing products through analysis or data science
Continuously champion high quality data practices - from architecture, normalization, data cleansing, data usage, data aggregation, data privacy & access control, tiered storage, and documentation - essentially the entire data lifecycle
Be a data evangelist to continuously grow awareness around our data and promote data-driven analysis and decision-making
Grow yourself and your team - mentorship enables everyone to learn and improve

Requirements
Proficient at digesting and analyzing large amounts of data, with a business mindset
Proficient in any SQL-based language, preferably MySQL
Experience with modern data storage, analysis and visualization platforms (relational and non-relational databases, MapReduce, Anaconda, Redash, etc.)
Experience with Google BigQuery
Experience with Python and/or R for data analysis is a plus
Self-driven to tackle challenges head-on and achieve goals
Role-modeling behaviors to lead others
Excellent communication skills to gather requirements from stakeholders to answer questions through data analysis
Excel at working with multiple stakeholders in small, dynamic, and fast-paced groups
Ability to communicate in written and spoken English
Curiosity and capacity to learn

detailDescription.1264:
About GM

There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

This role will enable faster and more impactful business decisions by Cadillac’s executive leadership team through the deployment and execution of advanced analytics, visualizations, business case preparations, and proof of concept software solutions. More specifically, this role will:
Help build & then execute Cadillac’s Corporate Strategy & Business Planning analytics capability (Methods, Tools, Processes/Procedures); from both internal & external sources
Develop actionable business insights by performing advanced analytics on a broad range of problems and data types; communicate findings both written and verbal in a clear, concise and compelling manner
Perform statistical modeling to determine KPI targets that meet volume and revenue objectives
Lead efforts to identify root cause of poor performance or KPI shortfalls
Perform analytical methodology process improvements
Identify predictive modeling opportunities (e.g., incentive optimization, supply chain, product development, dealer suggested ordering, etc…) and work collaboratively to execute them
Serve as liaison with GM IT, GM Chief Data & Analytics Office, and other GM analytics functions
Engage and collaborate with Cadillac Global team, Order Fulfillment, Logistics, Product Development, GM Digital & Marketing Analytics, GM Sales Analytics for synergies and cross pollination, development and resource efficiencies
Identify potential business risks, and uncover new opportunities to modify operations, expand revenue, or reduce cost through the use of advanced analytics
Stay abreast of the evolving advanced analytics landscape; bring best practices and leading-edge innovations to Cadillac Corporate Strategy & Business Planning
Aide Cadillac in pivoting toward a forward looking predictive mode of operation
Conduct factor analysis along with cluster analysis and other Euclidean methods to build objective global prioritizations & importance models
Perform customer & dealer survey analytics to determine improvement opportunities for new products, services, and customer experiences
Develop and implement solutions and methods to leverage Hadoop based GM data platform
Build prototype CX solutions leveraging internal data sources such as MAXIS, HADOOP, GM EDW, VTIMS, Freight Verify GPS, OnStar, MARS, VOMS, DID, DOD, and external data sources such as JD Power, Deloitte Insight Analytics, etc…
Build advanced visualization and monitoring tools using Tableau, Power BI
Build Excel based models and business cases to support special projects and campaigns
Essential Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor’s degree required
3-5 years of applicable Data Science and/or Advanced Analytics experience
Expert modeling in EXCEL using functions such as VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, Macros, pivot tables, advanced complex logic statements, and other advanced functions
Experience or education using data manipulation solutions: Horton Works, Spark, Cloudera, SQL, etc.
Working knowledge of statistical methods and their proper application e.g., principle component analysis, correspondence analysis, k-means cluster analysis, factor analysis, multi-variate analysis, data modeling, linear regressions, non-linear regressions, partial least squares techniques
Detailed Knowledge of Advanced and Predictive Analytical Methods e.g., Simulation, Design of Experiments, Genetic Algorithms, Ensemble Methods, Naïve Bayes, Neural Networks, Support Vector Machines, Interaction Effects, Importance modeling
Working knowledge and application of statistical software (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS, STATA, Spark, Python-based tools)
Ability to bring clarity, structure, and analytical rigor to complex ambiguous business problems
Highly proficient in pulling and analyzing raw data, along with developing impactful and insightful visualizations
Demonstrated experience with scenario and simulation development
Strong competencies in the following areas: Statistical Modeling; Research Design; Data Mining & Integration; Data Visualization; Computer Science; Database Science; Machine Learning; Programing & Scripting; Information Assurance; Mathematics; Operations Research, Programing (object oriented or otherwise)
Domain expertise in the following areas: Business Acumen, Project Management, Resource Allocation, Collaboration & Teamwork, Data Science Consulting
Demonstrates the following cognitive ability: Critical Thinking, Problem Solving, Inductive & Deductive Reasoning
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; proactively communicates with team and updates managers and stakeholders throughout the process
Possesses a high degree of perseverance, innovation & creativity, resilience & hardiness, inquisitiveness, adaptability/flexibility, ambiguity tolerance, detail orientation, self-confidence, work ethic; Ability and desire to contribute and thrive in a low-structure, growing and fast paced environment
Ability to execute multiple complex and long-term tasks with strong cross-department collaboration and high time-management acumen
Strong teamwork and communication skills and ability to work with all management levels
Ability to collaborate successfully in cross functional and cross-regional teams
Ability to make/recognize effective trade-off decisions and can negotiate skillfully in tough situations with both internal and external groups, can win concessions without damaging relationships
Ability to communicate complex concepts with compelling, simple and impactful delivery
Effective presentation skills in a variety of formal presentation settings: one-on-one, small and large groups with peers and superiors, and C-level executive teams inside and outside of the organization
Able to make sound decisions based upon a mixture of analysis, experience, and judgment
Natural initiative in decision making, execution and process improvement
Natural drive for making a contribution and creating new processes and methodologies
Additional Job Description

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS
Degree in related field (e.g., Data Science, Predictive Analytics, Statistics, Marketing Analytics, Applied Mathematics, IT)
Applicable Programing skills (e.g., R, Python, SAS, SQL, NoSQL)
Experience leveraging open-source platforms for advanced analytics application
Business administration or related field a plus
Automotive and/or Luxury Experience
Knowledge of key automotive industry syndicated research data providers (e.g., JDPA, Maritz, Strategic Vision, Polk)
Project Management or Process Management Certification (PMP, Six-Sigma, etc.)
Economics exposure
Other Considerations
Location: Warren, MI
Travel: <10%
Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.
Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

detailDescription.1268:
About The Role

If you’re looking to be a part of a dynamic, highly-analytical team and an opportunity to hone your analytical & data crunching skills, look no further. As our Marketing Analytics Intern for the Merchant Marketing team, you'll play an integral part in establishing and growing the team's analytical foundations. Along with assisting the team with in-depth data analysis, you'll be in charge of gathering data for reports and evaluations, running SQL queries, as well as providing suggestions for potential improvements for the team's merchant marketing endeavors. Working closely with the Marketing Intelligence team, you'll take a front row seat in seeing how to build and manage a world-class analytics team, one that serves the company's merchant partner base as a whole.

What You Will Do
Assist in analyzing, evaluating, and providing suggestions for improvement of Gojek Merchant Marketing activity
Regularly pull and process data to craft weekly and monthly performance reports and to evaluate marketing campaigns
Create data visualizations and real-time dashboards by using the vast amount of data from the data warehouse for decision-making purposes
Assist in providing insights and supporting data for marketing research activities
Assist the Marketing Intelligence Team on several growth-related projects

What You Will Need
Currently in your final year of studies/ freshly graduated, with knowledge in marketing and/or statistics
Proficiency in spreadsheet tools (Microsoft Excel) and Standard Query Language (SQL) is a must
Familiarity with BI Visualization Tools, such as Tableau, Google Data Studio, Metabase
Ability to utilize data analysis tools such as SPSS, Minitab, SAS, and basic programming languages such as Python is a plus
A strong attention to detail with an analytical mindset
Ability to thrive, adapt, and enjoy working in a fast-changing startup environment

About The Team

Our Performance Marketing & Intelligence team, a subsidiary of the larger Merchant Marketing team, is a family of 9 based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Working alongside the Data team, we oversee any data-related tasks and procedures for Merchant Marketing team, including data crunching and dashboard generation. For instance, should you have a question about identifying merchant partner segments, analyzing social media performance, or calculating real-time CAC, we are your people! Currently, our team has been busy working on building a marketing model for the wider Merchant team.

Working from home has been a strange time for a lot of us, so our team has been taking time on our calls to trade advice on the best ways to keep sane with this new work set up. We're a very close team made up of bookworms, gamers, coffee drinkers, and Netflix watchers. We look out for one another, and work together to get the job done.

About Us

Gojek is a Super App. It’s one app for ordering food, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, and dozen other products. It is Indonesia’s first and only decacorn. It's also the only Southeast Asian startup to be part of Fortune's list of 'Companies That Changed The World.'

Our Mission: To create and scale positive socio-economic impact for our customers, driver-partners, business and MSMEs.

As of 2018, Gojek processed more than $9 billion annualised gross transaction value across all markets where it operates - in Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and Indonesia. We have the largest food delivery product in Asia, (outside of China), and the largest payments wallet in Southeast Asia.

Our investors include Google, Facebook, PayPal, Sequoia Capital, Tencent Holdings among others.

Gojek is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

detailDescription.1285:
Company Description

Devoteam, a group of 7000+ digital transformakers, consists of multiple business units and entities spread around the world. We are one of them. With our main office in Stockholm (and our global presence on 6 other markets in EMEA and APAC) we are a mid-size company working closely with the group as leaders in the field of Google Cloud technology.

Our goal is to be one step ahead and to build valuable partnerships with the digital leaders. To be in the forefront we need to have the best talents in our team. That’s why we have a special approach to our employees.

With our Scandinavian heritage come the three pillars of our culture:
Curiosity: we are curious about people, technology, and business
Trust: our relationships are built on trust, empowering us to work as a single, cohesive organisation
Courage: we have the courage to challenge ourselves, our customers, and our partners

Job Description

About the Role:

We are looking for a highly motivated Cloud evangelist to use their experience in the public cloud to interpret our customers’ needs, and extract value from their data using GCP and its suite of tools. You will be involved in pre-sales activities as well as building upon our customers’ cloud infrastructure, and creating analytics in the cloud. We believe data architecture, data ingestion, data storage, and data analysis will be your passion. We want you to know and advocate for Google Cloud Platform and all of its products: Container Engine, Cloud SQL, BigQuery, Google Data Studio, etc. Knowledge in equivalent platforms could be an interesting asset, i.e. AWS or Azure, to make you a strong candidate. You must be outgoing, able to manage workshops and execute training on your own.

Part of the job will be to create proposals for your solutions, so professional writing skills in English is a must. As this is an expanding market for us, you will likely be involved in projects in all of our territories, and occasional travel can be expected.

Qualifications

Qualifications:
BA/BS in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent experience
Experience in one or more development languages, such as Java, Python, Go, PHP or similar
Enjoys programming in a test-driven, agile methodology
Knowledge of Linux and Windows infrastructure building capability
Knowledge of AI and ML technologies, frameworks, and APIs
Experience of drawing UML diagrams
Expert knowledge of database and data analysis technologies, including relational and NoSQL databases, data warehouse design, BI reporting and dashboard development
Experience in Hadoop and using platforms such as Apache Spark, Pig or Hive
Fluency in English
Fluency in an additional language: Bahasa (Indonesia)
It would be nice if you are or have:
MSc in Computer Science or related technical field About the team:

About The Team

Our cloud services team helps our customers big and small move to the cloud. The team is an extension of our customers’ internal IT and development teams, aiding them in managing their SaaS, Iaas, and PaaS environments. The team is passionate about moving to the cloud and helping our customers plan and execute their cloud strategies.

Additional Information

Devoteam is a full-scale cloud solutions partner, operating in Europe and beginning its expansion in Asia. Our mission is to add value to our customers by delivering a digital workplace based on sustainable solutions from leading innovative partners like Google and Salesforce, among others. This is achieved by our business-oriented teams, passionate tech experts and our strong company culture that make our employees excel.

Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

Job Description

& requirements

About Rukita

Rukita is the nation’s leading community-driven proptech company, improving urban living across major cities and for hundreds of members. We perfect the modern hassle-free rental experience using our unique approach, designing and operating co-living experiences.Rukita’s design-driven and end-to-end property management services - powered by technology - allows us to meet the needs of today’s urban living. Focusing on community, convenience and experience, we constantly push the boundaries of quality lives at an affordable price.The Rukita family is made out of a motley crew of real estate professionals, engineers, technologists, community builders, designers, marketers, happiness officers, and so much more. As a family, we work cohesively, collaboratively, value entrepreneurship, and do whatever it takes to deliver happiness in a living space.

About The Role

Rukita transforms spaces into affordable community-driven living solutions in urban areas. Rukita is looking for a Business Development Associate to support our Business Development Manager in obtaining new leads and maintaining relationships with Kost Owners, Managers, and Caretakers. As key area of the business, this position will give you a big opportunity for growth and you will also be required to be constantly on the move. The role will report to our Head of Business Development. This position will be placed in Jakarta

Responsibilities
Sourcing for Kost that Rukita will partner with to improve and manage
Builds and maintains relationships with Kost Owners, Kost Managers and Kost Caretakers
Informs the Kost strategy by keeping a pulse on market and submarket demand
End-to-end B2B sales negotiation
Requirements
1 – 3 years of experience in sales, real estate, or any other related areas
Experience in startup companies would be a plus
Passionate about sales and willing to work in the field
If possible, you have to be able to drive and/or own a motorcycle
Excellent inter-personal skills
You have a passion for providing living solutions for the new generation, sharing in Rukita’s mission
You’re comfortable working in a fast-paced dynamic startup environment
You must have a pro-active mindset and the ability to thoroughly look for opportunities
What We Offer

Rukita truly values our employees and treats them like family - and as such, we ensure that employees are not only professionally fulfilled, but happy and find individual growth. Because of this, we are committed to the following:
Health & wellness benefits (covering medical, vision insurance)
Generous leave (including parental leave!)
Potential equity packages
Daily (healthy and yummy) lunches
Job training
Development & learning opportunities

Business Development & Partnerships Sales Strategy & Management Business Development Customer Relationship Management Communication Skills
detailDescription.1287:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

Digital Intelligence is an agile startup within NielsenIQ that provides high end solutions using social media and consumer data. We are a global unit, and our customers are the largest consumer companies in the world.

The center of excellence is a team of social media experts, insights consultants, data scientists, and technologists.

This role will be part of the Sales and client development team – This will play a key role in announcing and establishing NielsenIQ’s presence in the Digital Intelligence solutions space across the globe. This team will ensure a steady sales pipeline and help the Digital Intelligence unit achieve its revenue targets.

Responsibilities
Own a revenue target
Prospect, identify, and generate new opportunities to build a pipeline of targeted prospects for the NielsenIQ Digital Intelligence suite of offerings
Have a thorough understanding of where and how the need for digital intelligence originates in the client organization, where does it fit in within the market research/ insights industry, and lastly, how does the NielsenIQ offering meet that need
Have a strong rigor of collecting market intelligence about prospective clients - services and products used, key stakeholders within, presence of competition, and so on.
Manage sales pipeline through sequential states of the sales process: prospect, initial outreach, Service offering pitch and product demo, generating an RFP ( Request for Proposal), building a proposal, consultative selling, price negotiation, and close
Develop existing clients – Engage and upsell
Monitor and report market intelligence and sales progress
Refine the pricing process, basis experience/inputs from Clients
Have the ability to engage across levels at the Client-side - tactical and agile with operation focussed executives and consultative partnering with C-suite executives
Establish a “trusted advisor” relationship to determine needs, build value, and create engagement with the NDI
Work with local Nielsen commercial teams – Domain training, Joint prospecting, Scoping, and selling
Track closely publications/ blogs/ articles on the digital Intelligence/ Social listening industry – regular feedback and education of internal teams on latest developments, trends, competitor activities including large wins and new product launches.

a Little Bit About You

Are you a hunter with a passion for sales and delighting clients? You will lead to strong commercial conversations and negotiations with C Suite Stakeholders. A self-starter who knows how to manage a sales pipeline and most importantly generate leads. A strong storyteller who is comfortable in presenting and pitching to senior stakeholders. Strong commitment to business growth with strong influencing, persuading, sales skills with excellent analytical skills. We are looking for passionate leaders, who can work with agility, flexibility and creative ways of thinking, to disrupt a fragmented social media intelligence market.

Qualifications
8-10 years of sales/business development experience with selling social media tools/solutions
Strong experience, knowledge, and relationships with clients in the Asia Pacific region specifically in the social listening industry
Excellent consultative proposal writing skills
Strong track record of sales performance in Social listening/ digital
Familiarity with social media tools such as Brandwatch, Talkwalker, Synthesio, Netbase
Have interacted with C-level executives in Client organizations
Strong executive presence with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Team player mentality with the ability to work independently
Excellent organizational skills including prioritization, scheduling and time management
Knowledge of the Thai/ Japanese/ Korean language a huge plus

Additional Information

About NielsenIQ

NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.

NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

detailDescription.1293:
Position: Management Trainee

Kulina is recruiting the best graduates globally to join our rotation program that will be placed in various areas of our business through the MT program. All MTs will report directly to the CEO, co-founders or management team members.

Development

You will follow a comprehensive program that will prepare you to become the future leader of our business. You will be placed in a department AND assigned to lead at least one project at a time. You will also get direct mentorship from our co-founders who are serial entrepreneurs.

Challenge

You will be rotating through various departments and projects which can last from 3-6 months. You must demonstrate high tenacity, passion, analytical skills and intelligence to meet those standards of behavior.

Your career

You will get a glimpse of Kulina and startup environment as well as our principles, values and codes of ethics, including our business value chain from beginning to end. During the program you will gain an in-depth knowledge of the company's foundations through training and various tasks. At the end of the program, you will be placed into a leadership position.

List of teams
Food Product Development and Operation
Marketing
Business Growth

Have a minimum GPA of 3.50

Analytical mindset

About The Role

As our Credit Risk Analyst, you'll take the wheel in identifying potential risks, and developing mitigation strategies in our fast-expanding business, you'll take the wheel in delivering target risk metrics by analyzing data and implementing risk rules, as well as influencing functional stakeholders to implement other broad risk control strategies for the company. With your stellar prioritization and stakeholder management skills, you'll help us ensure Alune as an Aquaculture investment, technology, and expertise to change the way aquaculture is financed, one that our farmers can count on.

There are various role – things you could be working on:
Conduct credit risk assessment for aquaculture industry specific, including financial and other data points analysis to help to assist in credit decisions.
Participate in working with the team to develop, improve and monitor our proprietary credit model (a core component of our business).
Identifying and analyzing trends and concentrations that could affect the risk and performance of portfolios
Perform standard daily and weekly analyses as well as customized risk analyses and communicate key findings to senior management
Perform other ad-hoc based tasks related to credit risk function

Minimum Qualifications

About You

Essential
Analytical mind and a proficient in mathematics; probability theory in particular
Knowledge of data analysis
Strategic mindset for mitigating risk
Proficient in English
A go-getter attitude
Coordination skills to understand the requirements of different departments with regard to risk
Problem-solving and entrepreneurial skills
Excellent attention to detail
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
The ability to identify opportunities to improve performance and efficiencies in existing systems
Knowledge of Business Intelligence software would be beneficial
Preferred academic background: Mathematics, Finance, Actuarial Science, Risk Management, Statistics

Desirable
A minimum 2 years in financial industry as an analyst (account manager/underwriter)
Preferably has experiences in both sides of risk and business department

Desired Skills and Experience
Mathematics, Financial Analysis, Financial Reporting, Financial Statement Analysis, Attention to Detail, Problem Solving, Computer Literate / Basic Computer Skills

detailDescription.1304:
About GM

There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Responsible for Electrical team Excel and software support. Identifies, prototypes and delivers software solutions for internal business customers to enable strong data driven business decisions. Leads business toward efficient software driven solutions
Utilize Apache HIVE / Hadoop for data analysis
Utilize SharePoint lists for small data gathering tasks
Ability to code DAX and Power Query (M)agic language
Assist engineers with financial reporting
Working knowledge of MS-Access, VBA and Power BI
Extensive knowledge of SQL and Python
Strong coding background
SharePoint development
Ability to generate metrics and KPI from multiple data sets
Support engineers in delivering QCWFT (Quality, Cost, Weight, Function Targets) for the electrical team
Forward thinking one team mindset that strives to deliver an enterprise solution
Understanding Total (True) Cost of Ownership at a vehicle and part level
Cross SMT collaboration
Data management skills
Train and mentor new engineers and buyers to understand GM Data systems
Develop projects from cradle to grave with minimal IT support
Project Work
Train and assist co-workers with Excel data to create and utilize pivot tables, formulas and visualization for improved efficiency
Develop Cost Modeling Tool using existing database information
Maintain Scope Creep Database and reporting for annual BP updates, new users
Maintain Owner’s Manual SharePoint with probable Cross SMT support
Single point contact for QNES (Suggestion program) coordination for Electrical
Data collection and entry for Prototype tooling database
Develop and maintain wiring harness reports for engineering and purchasing
Develop and maintain Vehicle Battery Alert dashboard
Basic Required

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Computer Science
5+ Years Experience in automotive (preferred)
3+ Years working with data
Ability to manage multiple tasks with a high level of accountability and autonomy
Knowledge of electrical cost
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and meeting facilitation skills
Knowledge of GM systems (preferred)
Understanding of product design and process interdependencies
Initiative to reach beyond current assignment and improve the output and/or help others
Strong Excel, SharePoint, Power BI and data management skills
Demonstrated advanced Excel skills (If statements, pivot tables, power query, Index-Match)
VBA, and SQL a must. Python preferred, JavaScript and/or Java nice to have
Ability to pass a basic coding test
Understanding of relational databases work (1 to ∞ relationships, Foreign Keys, etc…)
Strong Analytical Problem Solving Skills
Spanish ability (nice to have)
Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.
Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Company Description: Nityo Infotech is an information technology consulting company with its headquarters in Pittsburgh, USA and has a global presence spanning across USA, EMEA, APAC and India. Nityo is having operations in 17 countries with 27 offices across globe including US, Europe and Asia. At Nityo, our key focus is to empower our customers with customised business solutions through state of the art technology and best‐of‐breed business processes. Our portfolio of solutions and services includes infrastructure management services, outsourcing , system integration, Application Software development , IT consulting, IT Security Consulting , Cloud Computing, Data Science , Big Data Analytics , Artificial Intelligence, Industry specific products implementation & Support , Quality Assurance & Training. Nityo provides these services to several clients located across the globe, including many Fortune 1000 and Global 2000 companies, in the commercial, industrial and government sectors - across key vertical markets, like financial services, Manufacturing & Semiconductor, life sciences and healthcare, retail, telecommunications and utilities, Top notch System Integrator, and independent software vendors. Nityo has grown to become a global service provider of Infrastructure Management Services, Intellectual Property (IP) Leveraged Solutions, and IT Services, focused on the telecom, media, technology, manufacturing, power and healthcare industries. detailDescription.1322:
The Job: Integrations Developer - Salesforce
Pay rate: $20-30 per hour

***Salesforce APEX experience, a PLUS***

You will be a key member of the Agiloft engineering team responsible for delivering data integration projects.

The Senior Integrations Developer designs and implements the data integration of disparate systems and builds extensible data acquisition and integration solutions to meet the functional and non-functional requirements of the business. In this role the Integrations Developer implements processes and logic to extract, transform, and distribute data across one or more data stores from a wide variety of sources.

The Senior Integrations Developer provides problem-solving expertise and complex analysis of data to develop business intelligence integration designs with stakeholders in Agiloft or in customer projects and to translate functional specifications into technical designs for implementation and deployment, The Senior Integrations Developer develops and maintains data integration standards according to Agiloft’s information services policies as well as best practices, conducts reviews of other integration developers’ development efforts to ensure consistent methodologies are followed and to make recommendations where necessary.

You should have no less than three years of professional experience in building enterprise-grade applications with a focus on integrations and API and one year plus experience with Apex applications.

The ideal candidate is passionate about building software and must be comfortable with setting their own schedule and proactively collaborating in a globally dispersed team using a variety of communication channels. This is a remote-only position.

Job Responsibilities
Manage data analysis and data integration of disparate systems
Build extensible data integration solutions to meet the functional and non-functional requirements of the business
Implement processes and logic to extract, transform, and distribute data across one or more data stores from a wide variety of sources
Optimize the data integration platform to provide optimal performance under increasing data volumes
Provide problem-solving expertise and complex analysis of data to develop business intelligence integration designs
Develop and maintain data integration standards
Work with project stakeholders to translate functional specifications into technical designs for implementation and deployment
Ensure high quality and optimum performance of data integration systems in order to meet business solutions
Follow company guidelines for programming and documentation
Mentor Junior Integration Developers

Job Requirements
Minimum 3 years experience as Software Developer
Java Developer
Web Services (REST & SOAP)
RESTful API design and JSON data representation
Experience with J2EE, Tomcat, JBoss
Experience in Multi-threading is plus
Relational databases
Experience with Salesforce Apex
Experience working in geographically dispersed teams
Bachelor’s Degree

Preferred Qualifications
Good understanding of current database technologies and their application
Hands-on experience with building Salesforce applications
A keen interest to learn about new technologies
Fluent in English language

About Agiloft
Agiloft was named as the market leader in every category in the Gartner Critical Capabilities for CLM report, and a market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant. Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM) is one of the fastest-growing areas of enterprise sales, with a TAM projected to climb from $2B to $7B in the next 5 years.
The Agiloft Contract and Commerce Lifecycle Platform has won over a dozen awards, including the Editor's Choice award from PC Mag, for the past five years in a row.
Agiloft has a highly differentiated value proposition which is uniquely appealing to enterprises: pre-built applications with a deeply configurable, no-code platform for integrated Business Process Management throughout an organization.
Agiloft is pioneering the applied use of Artificial Intelligence to enable next-generation business commerce at organizations ranging from small enterprises to U.S. government agencies and Fortune 100 companies.
Agiloft is the only company in the industry with the confidence to provide an unconditional satisfaction guarantee, and you too will be successful with Agiloft.
As the leader in the CCLM market, Agiloft is winning many Enterprise deals and looking to hire the best talent to meet this demand with a competitive compensation plan that rewards overachievement.

Our Values: Honesty, Integrity, and Respect | Accountability | Client Focus | Continuous Improvement

The successful candidate will be a clear and persuasive communicator who is able to effectively communicate across the company.You will be equally comfortable thinking big, diving deep and rolling up your sleeves to validate hypotheses. You understand how to perform SEO, and work closely with product and technical teams to help scale your successful experiments.

Job Responsibilities

Job Description

The Opportunity

Be part of a supportive and elite team in a rapidly growing international software product company. Your career with us will combine cutting edge technology, exposure to worldwide clients across all industries, exciting growth paths, direct mentorship, and access to senior management.

Your mission will be to identify business deals by contacting potential customers in the ASEAN region and other territories as assigned; exploring opportunities with C-Level, managing your leads, prospecting and supporting marketing programs, both online and offline.

This is a full time position.

Duties & Responsibilities

As a Business Development Representative you will successfully employ a combination of excellent communication skills and technical knowledge to engage with potential customers.

Main Responsibilities For This Position Are
Outreach to people via phone and e-mail.
Effectively introduce and represent the Denodo product.
Accurately process leads, profiles and appointments.
Provide support to the sales team.
Schedule and make follow up calls.
Report issues or concerns to the team leader.
Perform research.
Accurately update Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software with customer data.

Qualifications

Desired Skills & Experience
min. 3+ years Inside sales / business development experience – software sales or high-tech products and services.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills in English and Bahasa.
Good conversation and people skills via telephone or e-mail, with a sales spin.
Good foundation to understand and learn IT technologies and enterprise information infrastructure.
Ability to quickly understand and carry out oral and written directions. Ability to be tactful and a good listener. Respect for discretion and confidentiality.
Organized, disciplined, and efficient.
Ability to work independently and multi-tasker.
Experience working with CRM systems, as well as good computer skills.
Ability to learn quickly and to problem-solve on the fly.
Must genuinely care about people and be a teamplayer.
Energetic and enthusiastic about the opportunity to work with a valuable and growing busines.

Additional Information

Employment Practices
We are committed to equal employment opportunity.
We respect, value and welcome diversity in our workforce.
We do not accept resumes from headhunters or suppliers that have not signed a formal fee agreement. Therefore, any resume received from an unapproved supplier will be considered unsolicited, and we will not be obligated to pay a referral fee.

detailDescription.1333:
About Raena

Raena helps digitally savvy millennials generate side income by selling high quality beauty products. We curate original and effective products from a trusted network of suppliers across the world, so our sellers are always assured of quality. We launched last year, and thousands of women are now driving meaningful income leveraging Raena’s platform. We free our sellers from the burden of investing capital up front, managing logistics, curating suppliers so that they can focus on growing their followers and engaging them with compelling content. We are a diverse and entrepreneurial team with experience working across China, India, South East Asia and the USA; at large corporates such as Alibaba, Google, Amazon and running our own startups. We are backed by leading investors and have recently raised a Series A from marquee global and local investors to scale our impact faster.

Our Culture

At Raena, our mission is to enable more people to become entrepreneurs. This translates to not just our customers, but our employees as well. Being an entrepreneur means being agile and fast, relentless and creative in the face of obstacles, owning not tasks but results and finally, listening to your instincts but backing it up with data. Our culture is open and transparent- everyone has access to all our metrics- and empowering. It's a great fit for those that like autonomy, speed and seeing the impact of their work.

The Role

This position offers an opportunity to leverage your understanding of SEO on behalf of a fast growing startup to help more sellers discover Raena and earn more.

This role requires a highly analytical mindset, a strong business sense, and robust problem solving skills.

Conducting SEO experiments using rigorous approaches and measurement methods (A/B tests, statistical methods) to evaluate their effectiveness
Working closely with product, technology and business intelligence teams to make sure the company’s infrastructure, architecture, and site features support and enhance the effectiveness of our SEO.
Ideal Profile

The successful candidate will have a proven track record of making data driven decisions, and working closely with technical, product and marketing teams to achieve success.

The successful candidate will be a clear and persuasive communicator who is able to effectively communicate across the company.You will be equally comfortable thinking big, diving deep and rolling up your sleeves to validate hypotheses. You understand how to perform SEO, and work closely with product and technical teams to help scale your successful experiments.
4+ years’ experience in the Search Engine Optimization field. Proven track record in managing SEO projects from inception to completion
Proven track record assuming ownership, moving quickly to implement ideas, and delivering results and in a fast-paced online environment.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills, and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, drive rationale, discover root causes and identify opportunities. Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience with Excel and capable of manipulating data in order to perform both high level and more granular analysis. This includes familiarity with VLookups, Pivot tables, and other such functionalities

detailDescription.1343:
Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Indonesia due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently, we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in managing digital marketing campaigns with online measurement and operations.
Experience presenting digital solutions to clients or direct sales experience.
Ability to speak and write in English and Bahasa Indonesia fluently.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with the technical aspects of digital and programmatic advertising, and experience working with product teams on scalable business solutions.
Experience creating and sharing “best practice” solutions to promote a culture of learning and having impact at scale.
Expertise across automation, audience, targeting, attribution and assets.
Expertise in overall search ecosystem with focus on accelerating customer success, business growth and driving product adoption.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to process large data sets and identify patterns of significance.


About The Job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grows. You leverage your entrepreneurial drive to target, educate and persuade new customers to embrace Google's latest advertising products and technologies. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of key clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As a Search Specialist, you will oversee the Search strategy for key customers across the entire business process. You'll drive in-depth solutions to help our search partners achieve their customer business objectives in partnership with the Large Customer Sales Teams through pitching and activating new products. You will advise them on growing their existing business, maximizing growth on their marketing investment, and unlock new business opportunities.

You'll also act as an advisor and consultant that works across functions and alongside global teams, as well as a customer advocate within Google.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

Responsibilities
Manage a book of business as a full-time Search Specialist, working across the entire business process (planning, presenting alongside in-country teams, implementing and optimizing).
Dive deep into the customer's business objectives and lead a holistic Search strategy. Be the Search leader to drive performance for them and growth in Google.

detailDescription.1351:
Location

Bogor, Indonesia

Description

PTHI is seeking a skilled environmental professional to join our infrastructure and extractives team at PTHI to help us build a sustainable future for our company and country. Your passion and expertise are essential to help grow our business, and we are offering an attractive opportunity to be part of a company that interacts across a wide range of sectors and clients, in Indonesia and internationally. The Senior Environmental Specialist will be part of the business development and management in a diversified company that is looking to expand into new markets.

PTHI recognizes the importance of a balanced approach to work. Along with rewarding professional development opportunities and a competitive salary, careers at PTHI come with benefits that help you grow within the company and contribute to the wider community.

The right candidate will be able to demonstrate experience in the infrastructure and extractives sectors, as well as the ability to work with and manage a diverse team of national and international specialists as you work with national and international clients and standards. In addition, you possess the ability to develop business within your network, along our existing lines of business, and pursue new lines of work that align with our vision and mission as a company. Overall, the ideal candidate shares our desire to grow the capability of our team to support our clients.

Responsibilities

Role and Responsibilities:
Lead multi-disciplinary teams to undertake projects related to environmental and social impact assessments, environmental and social due diligence against national and international standards, and other quality driven environmental studies.
Recommend, and develop appropriate studies and tools to answer study-specific environmental aspects within a range of projects in the infrastructure and extractives sectors.
Conduct data analysis and present results through reporting, presentations, or other documentation.
Manage project team activities including preparation of project work plans, schedules, budgets, technical activities, and coordination of technical staff and sub-consultants to ensure efficient use of corporate resources, preparation and editing of documents (proposals, reports, and geomatic outputs)
Ensure QA/QC on project outputs to ensure the highest possible standards, and any additional tasks required to ensure that project outputs are completed on time, on budget and to acceptable corporate standards.
Provide leadership in the implementation of company QHSE systems and policies.
Provide mentorship and guidance with team members to provide a dynamic work environment and develop a career path to meet team members’ and company goals.
Lead marketing and business development activities in the environmental sector in Indonesia and southeast Asia with private and public sector clients, as well as international developmental organizations. This will include: strengthening corporate relationships with existing clients; marketing and business development with potential clients; providing business intelligence for overall corporate marketing activities; remaining proficient with the direction and status of industry projects and opportunities; and providing assistance in the preparation of proposals and proposal negotiations with clients.


Competencies

Education and Experience:
Experience in leading or managing ESHIAs, DDs, and/or environmental management planning and monitoring for projects in Indonesia.
Experience in reporting and project management, using tools to track time management, budget management, and team management.
Excellent analytic and research skills (leveraging a sound knowledge of scientific literature).
Experience with designing and implementing scientific studies/field programs and managing field teams and the collection baseline data.
Experience with preparing regulatory applications for approvals and possess a sound working knowledge of national and provincial environmental legislation.
Experience operating in a dynamic consulting environment that requires flexibility and teamwork; and an ability/interest to work in the field, occasionally in remote locations for extended periods of time.
Working knowledge of Indonesian regulations and international standards related to natural resources and infrastructure and extractives.
Posses strong leadership, team management, and good interpersonal skills.
Ability to support business development and marketing activities using modern networking skills and able to leverage an existing network in the private sector, government, nongovernmental organizations and/or universities to develop new business opportunities.
Confident to undertake negotiation and mediation with senior decision makers, both internally and externally.
Strong spoken and written communication skills in both Bahasa Indonesia and English.


Education And Experience
M.Sc. in environmental management relevant fields, or equivalent post-secondary education.
Minimum 10 years experience in managing and implementing projects related to environmental, social, and health impact assessments (ESHIA), environmental and social due diligence (ESDD), environmental management and mitigation, and other services, preferably in a consulting environment and with a demonstrable track record of increasing responsibilities.
Proficient with national regulations regarding environmental impact assessments, and environmental permitting.
Experience implementing projects complying with international standards/safeguards, i.e., International Finance Corporation (IFC) Performance Standards and World Bank Environmental and Social Framework.
Experience in developing and recommending studies and approaches for clients to achieve compliance with international standards for environmental and social risk management.
Experience operating in a dynamic consulting environment that requires flexibility and teamwork; and an ability/interest to work in the field, occasionally in remote locations for extended periods of time.
Experience providing mentorship to technical and non-technical team members.

To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume describing your experience and salary expectations through email to: ******** (no phone calls please). Please include “Senior Environmental Specialist” in your email subject line. Only short-listed candidates will be notified. Please submit only via email and not through the online submission “Apply Now” form.

detailDescription.1359:
Capabilities

Technology & digital

Industries

Technology industries

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

Digital BCG

BCG has a long history of driving growth by embracing innovation and new ways of thinking. Through DigitalBCG, we bring together a diverse mix of consultants and digital specialists to ensure that we are supporting our clients throughout their digital transformation journeys. We work with our clients to fully understand the impact of digital on their business and set priorities that will transform their vision into value. Whether it be developing new technologies to support their core business, making better use of their data, or pursuing entirely new sources of revenue, our aim is to achieve radical improvements in productivity, flexibility, and speed. We are innovating how our clients are using artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, internet of things, personalization, blockchain technologies, and more to gain competitive advantage.

DigitalBCG encompasses a broad set of data, digital, and technology capabilities from BCG consulting teams and practices, along with our business units such as BCG Digital Ventures, BCG Platinion, and BCG GAMMA.

Practice Area Profile

BCG’s Technology Advantage (TA) practice focuses on helping clients deliver competitive advantage and business superior performance through the use of data, technology and digital. TA is the fastest growing practice at BCG and at the heart of the strategic impact we have with our clients. Our consultants and experts globally work across all industries and provide deep experience and expertise across a number of topics including: * Digital Transformation * Data & Digital Platforms * Software & Agile * Digitizing the Tech Function

What You'll Do

Our clients are senior business and IT executives who value BCG's bias-free, independent, and impact-oriented approach. We work with CIOs and CTOs as well as their business-side counterparts to bring a competitive advantage through data, technology and digital solutions to solve their business needs. As we have no financial interest in downstream IT implementation or outsourcing services, BCG acts as an objective IT Navigator™.

BCG's TA practice is growing very rapidly and we are aggressively building our capability by adding consultants with significant experience and depth in Information Technology and demonstrated leadership in client relations, practice development, people and knowledge development.to our ranks. This experience could come from IT consulting and/or a broad range of technology backgrounds who aspire to learn how to solve strategic business problems through technology.

What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)
Strong academics from top-tier institutions (top 10% of class)
MS or MBA preferred, graduate of a leading engineering school would be a plus,
Excellent written and spoken English, other Asian languages a bonus
Experience within Telecommunications, Financial Services or a large global IT system integrator, a software vendor professional services organization or a technology start-up
Management consulting experience preferred
Experience addressing business challenges leveraging Technology solutions
Exposure to deep dive IT diagnostics, experience identifying value creation opportunities
Good understanding of enterprise architecture principles
Professional Skills:
Analytical and structured
Able to work creatively and analytically in a time-limited, problem-solving environment
Excellent communication skills
Able to build empathy within the firm and win the trust of the clients
Highly professional and rigorous
Able to think strategically/end-to-end
Good business sense
Results-oriented
Willing to travel extensively and to work on client sites

JAC Recruitment operates in 11 countries with 26 offices in London, Singapore, Japan, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, China, Korea, Hong Kong, Vietnam and India. JAC Recruitment Indonesia started in 2002 in Jakarta, and then expanded offices in Bekasi, Karawang and Surabaya. With more than 100 consultants, we are committed for our clients and candidates satisfaction by connecting the right positions to the right people Job Description:
Main Competencies Requirements
We are looking for a SAAS Enterprise Account Manager to play a critical role in building relationships with significant clients. Our ideal candidate should ensure client satisfaction and be able to identify new opportunities to increase revenue.
As an Enterprise account manager, you will represent company and interact with major clients. So, if you have excellent communication skills with a customer service attitude, we would like to meet you.

The Key Responsibilities
To exceed monthly / quarterly sales targets by selling SAAS Products into enterprise accounts and within an assigned geographical or vertical market. You will manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts.
Territory identification and research, to formalize a go to market territory strategy and create a qualified target account list within 30 days.
Pipeline development through a combination of cold calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence.
Create and maintain a sales pipeline to ensure over-achievement within the designated market sector(s).
Engage with prospect organizations to position SAAS solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data.Manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Sales Engineers, Professional Services, Executives, Partners etc.
Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation.
Daily update of the Salesforce system with accurate customer and pipeline data.
Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery.

Nityo has grown to become a global service provider of Infrastructure Management Services, Intellectual Property (IP) Leveraged Solutions, and IT Services, focused on the telecom, media, technology, manufacturing, power and healthcare industries.
